original: וַיֹּאמֶר֩  אֵלָ֨יו  הָֽאֱלֹהִ֜ים  בַּחֲלֹ֗ם  גַּ֣ם  אָנֹכִ֤י  יָדַ֨עְתִּי֙  כִּ֤י  בְתָם־ לְבָבְךָ֙  עָשִׂ֣יתָ  זֹּ֔את  וָאֶחְשֹׂ֧ךְ  גַּם־ אָנֹכִ֛י  אֽוֹתְךָ֖  מֵחֲטוֹ־ לִ֑י  עַל־ כֵּ֥ן  לֹא־ נְתַתִּ֖יךָ  לִנְגֹּ֥עַ  אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
translation: And God said to him in a dream, "Indeed, I also knew that in the integrity of your heart you have done this, and I also withheld you from sinning against Me. Therefore, I did not allow you to touch her."

original: וְעַתָּ֗ה  הָשֵׁ֤ב  אֵֽשֶׁת־ הָאִישׁ֙  כִּֽי־ נָבִ֣יא  ה֔וּא  וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֥ל  בַּֽעַדְךָ֖  וֶֽחְיֵ֑ה  וְאִם־ אֵֽינְךָ֣  מֵשִׁ֗יב  כִּי־ מ֣וֹת  תָּמ֔וּת  אַתָּ֖ה  וְכָל־ אֲשֶׁר־ לָֽךְ׃
translation: And now, restore the man’s wife, for he is a prophet, and he will pray on your behalf, and you will live. But if you do not restore her, know that you will surely die—you and all who are yours.

original: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם  אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ  בַּבֹּ֗קֶר  וַיִּקְרָא֙  לְכָל־ עֲבָדָ֔יו  וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר  אֶת־ כָּל־ הַדְּבָרִ֥ים  הָאֵ֖לֶּה  בְּאָזְנֵיהֶ֑ם  וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ  הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים  מְאֹֽד׃
translation: And Abimelech rose early in the morning, and he called all his servants and spoke all these words in their hearing. And the men were exceedingly afraid.

original: וַיִּקְרָ֨א  אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ  לְאַבְרָהָ֗ם  וַיֹּ֨אמֶר  ל֜וֹ  מֶֽה־ עָשִׂ֤יתָ  לָּ֨נוּ֙  וּלָ֔ךְ  כִּֽי־ הֵבֵ֧אתָ  עָלַ֛י  וְעַל־ מַמְלַכְתִּ֖י  חֲטָאָ֣ה  גְדֹלָ֑ה  מַעֲשִׂים֙  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  לֹא־ יֵֽעָשׂ֔וּ  עָשִׂ֖יתָ  עִמָּדִֽי׃
translation: And Abimelech called to Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us and to yourself? For you have brought upon me and upon my kingdom a great sin. Deeds which ought not to be done, you have done with me.”

original: וַֽיהוָ֛ה  פָּקַ֥ד  אֶת־ שָׂרָ֖ה  כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר  אָמָ֑ר  וַיַּ֧עַשׂ  יְהוָ֛ה  לְשָׂרָ֖ה  כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר  דִּבֵּֽר׃
translation: And the LORD attended to Sarah as He had said, and the LORD did for Sarah as He had spoken.

original: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר֙  לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם  גָּרֵ֛שׁ  הָאָמָ֥ה  הַזֹּ֖את  וְאֶת־ בְּנָ֑הּ  כִּ֣י  לֹ֤א  יִירַשׁ֙  בֶּן־ הָאָמָ֣ה  הַזֹּ֔את  עִם־ בְּנִ֖י  עִם־ יִצְחָֽק׃
translation: And she said to Abraham, "Drive out this slave woman and her son, for the son of this slave woman shall not inherit with my son, with Isaac."

original: וַיֵּ֧רַע  הַדָּבָ֛ר  מְאֹ֖ד  בְּעֵינֵ֣י  אַבְרָהָ֑ם  עַ֖ל  אוֹדֹ֥ת  בְּנֽוֹ׃
translation: And the matter was exceedingly grievous in the eyes of Abraham, concerning his son.

original: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר  אֱלֹהִ֜ים  אֶל־ אַבְרָהָ֗ם  אַל־ יֵרַ֤ע  בְּעֵינֶ֨יךָ֙  עַל־ הַנַּ֣עַר  וְעַל־ אֲמָתֶ֔ךָ  כֹּל֩  אֲשֶׁ֨ר  תֹּאמַ֥ר  אֵלֶ֛יךָ  שָׂרָ֖ה  בְּקֹלָ֑הּ  כִּ֣י  בְיִצְחָ֔ק  יִקָּרֵ֥א  לְךָ֖  זָֽרַע׃
translation: And God said to Abraham, "Let it not be displeasing in your sight concerning the boy and concerning your maidservant. Whatever Sarah says to you, obey her voice, for through Isaac shall your offspring be named."

original: וְגַ֥ם  אֶת־ בֶּן־ הָאָמָ֖ה  לְג֣וֹי  כִּ֥י  זַרְעֲךָ֖  הֽוּא׃
translation: And also the son of the maidservant—I will make him into a nation, for he is your offspring.

original: וְאֶ֨ת־ הָעָ֔ם  אֹת֖וֹ  לֶעָרִ֑ים  מִקְצֵ֥ה  גְבוּל־ מִצְרַ֖יִם  וְעַד־ קָצֵֽהוּ׃
translation: And the people, him to the cities, from the edge of the border of Egypt to its end.

original: רַ֛ק  אַדְמַ֥ת  הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים  לֹ֣א  קָנָ֑ה  כִּי֩  חֹ֨ק  לַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים  מֵאֵ֣ת  פַּרְעֹ֗ה  וְאָֽכְל֤וּ  אֶת־ חֻקָּם֙  אֲשֶׁ֨ר  נָתַ֤ן  לָהֶם֙  פַּרְעֹ֔ה  עַל־ כֵּ֕ן  לֹ֥א  מָכְר֖וּ  אֶת־ אַדְמָתָֽם׃
translation: Only the land of the priests he did not acquire, for it was a statute for the priests from Pharaoh, and they ate their allotted portion which Pharaoh had given to them. Therefore, they did not sell their land.

original: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  יוֹסֵף֙  אֶל־ הָעָ֔ם  הֵן֩  קָנִ֨יתִי  אֶתְכֶ֥ם  הַיּ֛וֹם  וְאֶת־ אַדְמַתְכֶ֖ם  לְפַרְעֹ֑ה  הֵֽא־ לָכֶ֣ם  זֶ֔רַע  וּזְרַעְתֶּ֖ם  אֶת־ הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
translation: And Joseph said to the people, “Behold, I have acquired you this day, and your land, for Pharaoh. Here is seed for you, and you shall sow the land.”

original: וְהָיָה֙  בַּתְּבוּאֹ֔ת  וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם  חֲמִישִׁ֖ית  לְפַרְעֹ֑ה  וְאַרְבַּ֣ע  הַיָּדֹ֡ת  יִהְיֶ֣ה  לָכֶם֩  לְזֶ֨רַע  הַשָּׂדֶ֧ה  וּֽלְאָכְלְכֶ֛ם  וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר  בְּבָתֵּיכֶ֖ם  וְלֶאֱכֹ֥ל  לְטַפְּכֶֽם׃
translation: And it shall come to pass at the harvest that you shall give a fifth to Pharaoh, and the four parts shall be yours: for the seed of the field, and for your food, and for those in your households, and for your children to eat.

original: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ  הֶחֱיִתָ֑נוּ  נִמְצָא־ חֵן֙  בְּעֵינֵ֣י  אֲדֹנִ֔י  וְהָיִ֥ינוּ  עֲבָדִ֖ים  לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
translation: And they said, “You have preserved our lives; we have found favor in the eyes of my lord, and we shall be servants to Pharaoh.”

original: וַיָּ֣שֶׂם  אֹתָ֣הּ  יוֹסֵ֡ף  לְחֹק֩  עַד־ הַיּ֨וֹם  הַזֶּ֜ה  עַל־ אַדְמַ֥ת  מִצְרַ֛יִם  לְפַרְעֹ֖ה  לַחֹ֑מֶשׁ  רַ֞ק  אַדְמַ֤ת  הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙  לְבַדָּ֔ם  לֹ֥א  הָיְתָ֖ה  לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
translation: And Joseph established it as a statute, to this day, over the land of Egypt for Pharaoh, that a fifth part should be given; only the land of the priests alone did not belong to Pharaoh.

original: וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב  יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל  בְּאֶ֥רֶץ  מִצְרַ֖יִם  בְּאֶ֣רֶץ  גֹּ֑שֶׁן  וַיֵּאָחֲז֣וּ  בָ֔הּ  וַיִּפְר֥וּ  וַיִּרְבּ֖וּ  מְאֹֽד׃
translation: And Israel settled in the land of Egypt, in the land of Goshen, and they took possession of it; and they were fruitful and multiplied exceedingly.

original: וַיְחִ֤י  יַעֲקֹב֙  בְּאֶ֣רֶץ  מִצְרַ֔יִם  שְׁבַ֥ע  עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה  שָׁנָ֑ה  וַיְהִ֤י  יְמֵֽי־ יַעֲקֹב֙  שְׁנֵ֣י  חַיָּ֔יו  שֶׁ֣בַע  שָׁנִ֔ים  וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים  וּמְאַ֖ת  שָׁנָֽה׃
translation: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years. And the days of Jacob, the years of his life, were one hundred and forty-seven years.

original: וַיִּקְרְב֣וּ  יְמֵֽי־ יִשְׂרָאֵ֘ללָמוּת֒  וַיִּקְרָ֣א׀ לִבְנ֣וֹ  לְיוֹסֵ֗ף  וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  לוֹ֙  אִם־ נָ֨א  מָצָ֤אתִי  חֵן֙  בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ  יָדְךָ֖  תַּ֣חַת  יְרֵכִ֑י  עָשִׂ֤יתָ  עִמָּדִי֙  חֶ֣סֶד  וֶאֱמֶ֔ת  אַל־ נָ֥א  תִקְבְּרֵ֖נִי  בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
translation: And the days of Israel drew near to die, and he called for his son Joseph and said to him, "If now I have found favor in your eyes, place your hand under my thigh. You have shown me steadfast love and faithfulness; do not bury me in Egypt."

original: אַתָּ֣ה  תְדַבֵּ֔ר  אֵ֖ת  כָּל־ אֲשֶׁ֣ר  אֲצַוֶּ֑ךָּ  וְאַהֲרֹ֤ן  אָחִ֨יךָ֙  יְדַבֵּ֣ר  אֶל־ פַּרְעֹ֔ה  וְשִׁלַּ֥ח  אֶת־ בְּנֵֽי־ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל  מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
translation: You shall speak all that I command you, and Aaron your brother shall speak to Pharaoh, that he may send the children of Israel out of his land.

original: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  יְהוָה֙  אֶל־ מֹשֶׁ֔ה  כָּבֵ֖ד  לֵ֣ב  פַּרְעֹ֑ה  מֵאֵ֖ן  לְשַׁלַּ֥ח  הָעָֽם׃
translation: And the LORD said to Moses, "Pharaoh's heart is hardened; he refuses to let the people go."

original: לֵ֣ךְ  אֶל־ פַּרְעֹ֞ה  בַּבֹּ֗קֶר  הִנֵּה֙  הַמַּ֔יְמָה  וְנִצַּבְתָּ֥  לִקְרָאת֖וֹ  עַל־ שְׂפַ֣ת  הַיְאֹ֑ר  וְהַמַּטֶּ֛ה  אֲשֶׁר־ נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ  לְנָחָ֖שׁ  תִּקַּ֥ח  בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
translation: Go to Pharaoh in the morning; behold, he is going out to the water, and you shall station yourself to meet him on the bank of the river. And the staff that was turned into a serpent you shall take in your hand.

original: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣  אֵלָ֗יו  יְהוָ֞ה  אֱלֹהֵ֤י  הָעִבְרִים֙  שְׁלָחַ֤נִי  אֵלֶ֨יךָ֙  לֵאמֹ֔ר  שַׁלַּח֙  אֶת־ עַמִּ֔י  וְיַֽעַבְדֻ֖נִי  בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר  וְהִנֵּ֥ה  עַד־ כֹּֽה׃
translation: And you shall say to him, “The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, has sent me to you, saying, ‘Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness.’ And behold, until now you have not obeyed.”

original: כֹּ֚ה  אָמַ֣ר  יְהוָ֔ה  בְּזֹ֣את  כִּ֖י  אֲנִ֣י  יְהוָ֑ה  הִנֵּ֨ה  אָנֹכִ֜י  מַכֶּ֣ה׀ בַּמַּטֶּ֣ה  אֲשֶׁר־ בְּיָדִ֗י  עַל־ הַמַּ֛יִם  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  בַּיְאֹ֖ר  וְנֶהֶפְכ֥וּ  לְדָֽם׃
translation: Thus says the LORD: "By this you shall know that I am the LORD. Behold, I am about to strike with the staff that is in my hand upon the waters that are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood."

original: וְהַדָּגָ֧ה  אֲשֶׁר־ בַּיְאֹ֛ר  תָּמ֖וּת  וּבָאַ֣שׁ  הַיְאֹ֑ר  וְנִלְא֣וּ  מִצְרַ֔יִם  לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת  מַ֖יִם  מִן־ הַיְאֹֽר׃ס
translation: And the fish that are in the Nile will die, and the Nile will become foul, and the Egyptians will grow weary of drinking water from the Nile.

original: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר  יְהוָ֜ה  אֶל־ מֹשֶׁ֗ה  אֱמֹ֣ר  אֶֽל־ אַהֲרֹ֡ן  קַ֣ח  מַטְּךָ֣  וּנְטֵֽה־ יָדְךָ֩  עַל־ מֵימֵ֨י  מִצְרַ֜יִם  עַֽל־ נַהֲרֹתָ֣ם׀ עַל־ יְאֹרֵיהֶ֣ם  וְעַל־ אַגְמֵיהֶ֗ם  וְעַ֛ל  כָּל־ מִקְוֵ֥ה  מֵימֵיהֶ֖ם  וְיִֽהְיוּ־ דָ֑ם  וְהָ֤יָה  דָם֙  בְּכָל־ אֶ֣רֶץ  מִצְרַ֔יִם  וּבָעֵצִ֖ים  וּבָאֲבָנִֽים׃
translation: And the LORD said to Moses, "Say to Aaron, 'Take your staff and stretch out your hand over the waters of Egypt—over their rivers, over their canals, over their ponds, and over all their reservoirs of water—so that they may become blood. And there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, even in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.'"

original: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־ כֵן֩  מֹשֶׁ֨ה  וְאַהֲרֹ֜ן  כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר׀ צִוָּ֣ה  יְהוָ֗ה  וַיָּ֤רֶם  בַּמַּטֶּה֙  וַיַּ֤ךְ  אֶת־ הַמַּ֨יִם֙  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  בַּיְאֹ֔ר  לְעֵינֵ֣י  פַרְעֹ֔ה  וּלְעֵינֵ֖י  עֲבָדָ֑יו  וַיֵּהָֽפְכ֛וּ  כָּל־ הַמַּ֥יִם  אֲשֶׁר־ בַּיְאֹ֖ר  לְדָֽם׃
translation: And Moses and Aaron did so, just as the LORD had commanded. And he lifted up the staff and struck the water that was in the Nile, in the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his servants. And all the water that was in the Nile was turned to blood.

original: וְהַדָּגָ֨ה  אֲשֶׁר־ בַּיְאֹ֥ר  מֵ֨תָה֙  וַיִּבְאַ֣שׁ  הַיְאֹ֔ר  וְלֹא־ יָכְל֣וּ  מִצְרַ֔יִם  לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת  מַ֖יִם  מִן־ הַיְאֹ֑ר  וַיְהִ֥י  הַדָּ֖ם  בְּכָל־ אֶ֥רֶץ  מִצְרָֽיִם׃
translation: And the fish that were in the Nile died, and the Nile became foul, so that the Egyptians could not drink water from the Nile. And there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.

original: עָזִּ֤י  וְזִמְרָת֙  יָ֔הּ  וַֽיְהִי־ לִ֖י  לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה  זֶ֤ה  אֵלִי֙  וְאַנְוֵ֔הוּ  אֱלֹהֵ֥י  אָבִ֖י  וַאֲרֹמְמֶֽנְהוּ׃
translation:
The LORD is my strength and my song,  
and He has become my salvation.  
This is my God, and I will exalt Him;  
the God of my father, and I will praise Him.

original: כִּ֣י  בָא֩  ס֨וּס  פַּרְעֹ֜ה  בְּרִכְבּ֤וֹ  וּבְפָרָשָׁיו֙  בַּיָּ֔ם  וַיָּ֧שֶׁב  יְהוָ֛ה  עֲלֵהֶ֖ם  אֶת־ מֵ֣י  הַיָּ֑ם  וּבְנֵ֧י  יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל  הָלְכ֥וּ  בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה  בְּת֥וֹךְ  הַיָּֽם׃פ
translation: For the horses of Pharaoh, with his chariots and his horsemen, went into the sea, and the LORD turned back upon them the waters of the sea; but the children of Israel walked on dry ground in the midst of the sea.

original: וַתִּקַּח֩  מִרְיָ֨ם  הַנְּבִיאָ֜ה  אֲח֧וֹת  אַהֲרֹ֛ן  אֶת־ הַתֹּ֖ף  בְּיָדָ֑הּ  וַתֵּצֶ֤אןָ  כָֽל־ הַנָּשִׁים֙  אַחֲרֶ֔יהָ  בְּתֻפִּ֖ים  וּבִמְחֹלֹֽת׃
translation: Then Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took the tambourine in her hand, and all the women went out after her with tambourines and with dancing.

original: וַתַּ֥עַן  לָהֶ֖ם  מִרְיָ֑ם  שִׁ֤ירוּ  לַֽיהוָה֙  כִּֽי־ גָאֹ֣ה  גָּאָ֔ה  ס֥וּס  וְרֹכְב֖וֹ  רָמָ֥ה  בַיָּֽם׃ס
translation: And Miriam responded to them, saying, "Sing to the LORD, for He has triumphed gloriously; the horse and its rider He has hurled into the sea."

original: וַיַּסַּ֨ע  מֹשֶׁ֤ה  אֶת־ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙  מִיַּם־ ס֔וּף  וַיֵּצְא֖וּ  אֶל־ מִדְבַּר־ שׁ֑וּר  וַיֵּלְכ֧וּ  שְׁלֹֽשֶׁת־ יָמִ֛ים  בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר  וְלֹא־ מָ֥צְאוּ  מָֽיִם׃
translation: And Moses caused Israel to journey from the Red Sea, and they went out into the Wilderness of Shur. And they traveled three days in the wilderness, and they did not find water.

original: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ  מָרָ֔תָה  וְלֹ֣א  יָֽכְל֗וּ  לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת  מַ֨יִם֙  מִמָּרָ֔ה  כִּ֥י  מָרִ֖ים  הֵ֑ם  עַל־ כֵּ֥ן  קָרָֽא־ שְׁמָ֖הּ  מָרָֽה׃
translation: And they came to Marah, but they could not drink the water of Marah, for it was bitter. Therefore, he called its name Marah.

original: וַיִּלֹּ֧נוּ  הָעָ֛ם  עַל־ מֹשֶׁ֥ה  לֵּאמֹ֖ר  מַה־ נִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
translation: And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”

original: וַיִּצְעַ֣ק  אֶל־ יְהוָ֗ה  וַיּוֹרֵ֤הוּ  יְהוָה֙  עֵ֔ץ  וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֙  אֶל־ הַמַּ֔יִם  וַֽיִּמְתְּק֖וּ  הַמָּ֑יִם  שָׁ֣ם  שָׂ֥ם  ל֛וֹ  חֹ֥ק  וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט  וְשָׁ֥ם  נִסָּֽהוּ׃
translation: And he cried out to the LORD, and the LORD showed him a tree. And he threw it into the water, and the waters were made sweet. There He established for them a statute and an ordinance, and there He tested them.

original: וַיֹּאמֶר֩  אִם־ שָׁמ֨וֹעַ  תִּשְׁמַ֜ע  לְק֣וֹל׀ יְהוָ֣ה  אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ  וְהַיָּשָׁ֤ר  בְּעֵינָיו֙  תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה  וְהַֽאֲזַנְתָּ֙  לְמִצְוֺתָ֔יו  וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֖  כָּל־ חֻקָּ֑יו  הַמַּֽחֲלָ֞ה  אֲשֶׁר־ שַׂ֤מְתִּי  בְמִצְרַ֨יִם֙  כִּ֛י  אֲנִ֥י  יְהוָ֖ה  רֹפְאֶֽךָ׃ס
translation: And He said, "If you will indeed listen to the voice of the LORD your God, and do what is right in His sight, and give ear to His commandments, and keep all His statutes, I will not bring upon you any of the diseases that I brought upon Egypt, for I am the LORD your healer."

original: וּמִפֶּתַח֩  אֹ֨הֶל  מוֹעֵ֜ד  לֹ֤א  תֵֽצְאוּ֙  פֶּן־ תָּמֻ֔תוּ  כִּי־ שֶׁ֛מֶן  מִשְׁחַ֥ת  יְהוָ֖ה  עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם  וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ  כִּדְבַ֥ר  מֹשֶֽׁה׃פ
translation: And from the entrance of the tent of meeting, you shall not go out, lest you die, for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.

original: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר  יְהוָ֔ה  אֶֽל־ אַהֲרֹ֖ן  לֵאמֹֽר׃
translation: And the LORD spoke to Aaron, saying:

original: יַ֣יִן  וְשֵׁכָ֞ר  אַל־ תֵּ֣שְׁתְּ׀ אַתָּ֣ה׀ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ  אִתָּ֗ךְ  בְּבֹאֲכֶ֛ם  אֶל־ אֹ֥הֶל  מוֹעֵ֖ד  וְלֹ֣א  תָמֻ֑תוּ  חֻקַּ֥ת  עוֹלָ֖ם  לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
translation: You and your sons with you shall not drink wine or strong drink when you enter the tent of meeting, so that you may not die. It is a permanent statute throughout your generations.

original: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר  יְהוָ֛ה  אֶל־ מֹשֶׁ֥ה  וְאֶֽל־ אַהֲרֹ֖ן  לֵאמֹ֥ר  אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
translation: And the LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying to them:

original: וְכֹל֩  אֲשֶׁ֨ר  אֵֽין־ ל֜וֹ  סְנַפִּ֣יר  וְקַשְׂקֶ֗שֶׂת  בַּיַּמִּים֙  וּבַנְּחָלִ֔ים  מִכֹּל֙  שֶׁ֣רֶץ  הַמַּ֔יִם  וּמִכֹּ֛ל  נֶ֥פֶשׁ  הַחַיָּ֖ה  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  בַּמָּ֑יִם  לָכֶֽם׃
translation: And all that does not have fins and scales in the seas and in the rivers—of all the swarming creatures of the water and of all the living creatures that are in the water—are detestable to you.

original: וְשֶׁ֖קֶץ  יִהְי֣וּ  לָכֶ֑ם  מִבְּשָׂרָם֙  לֹ֣א  תֹאכֵ֔לוּ  וְאֶת־ נִבְלָתָ֖ם  תְּשַׁקֵּֽצוּ׃
translation: And they shall be an abomination to you. You shall not eat their flesh, and their carcass you shall detest.

original: כֹּ֣ל  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  אֵֽין־ ל֛וֹ  סְנַפִּ֥יר  וְקַשְׂקֶ֖שֶׂת  בַּמָּ֑יִם  לָכֶֽם׃
translation: Everything in the waters that does not have fins and scales is for you.

original: וְאֶת־ אֵ֨לֶּה֙  תְּשַׁקְּצ֣וּ  מִן־ הָע֔וֹף  שֶׁ֣קֶץ  הֵ֑ם  אֶת־ הַנֶּ֨שֶׁר֙  וְאֶת־ הַפֶּ֔רֶס  וְאֵ֖ת  הָעָזְנִיָּֽה׃
translation: And these you shall detest among the birds; they are an abomination: the eagle, the bearded vulture, and the black vulture.

original: וְאֶת־ הַ֨דָּאָ֔ה  וְאֶת־ הָאַיָּ֖ה  לְמִינָֽהּ׃
translation: and the kite, and the falcon, according to its kind.

original: אֵ֥ת  כָּל־ עֹרֵ֖ב  לְמִינֽוֹ׃
translation: every raven according to its kind.

original: וְאֵת֙  בַּ֣ת  הַֽיַּעֲנָ֔ה  וְאֶת־ הַתַּחְמָ֖ס  וְאֶת־ הַשָּׁ֑חַף  וְאֶת־ הַנֵּ֖ץ  לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
translation: And the ostrich, and the night bird, and the gull, and the hawk according to its kind.

original: וְאֶת־ הַכּ֥וֹס  וְאֶת־ הַשָּׁלָ֖ךְ  וְאֶת־ הַיַּנְשֽׁוּף׃
translation: And the little owl, and the pelican, and the great owl.

original: וְאֶת־ הַתִּנְשֶׁ֥מֶת  וְאֶת־ הַקָּאָ֖ת  וְאֶת־ הָרָחָֽם׃
translation: and the barn owl, and the desert owl, and the carrion vulture.

original: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ  בָּלָ֔ק  כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר  דִּבֶּ֣ר  בִּלְעָ֑ם  וַיַּ֨עַל  בָּלָ֧ק  וּבִלְעָ֛ם  פָּ֥ר  וָאַ֖יִל  בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
translation: And Balak did as Balaam had spoken, and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on the altar.

original: לֹ֣א  אִ֥ישׁ  אֵל֙  וִֽיכַזֵּ֔ב  וּבֶן־ אָדָ֖ם  וְיִתְנֶחָ֑ם  הַה֤וּא  אָמַר֙  וְלֹ֣א  יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה  וְדִבֶּ֖ר  וְלֹ֥א  יְקִימֶֽנָּה׃
translation: God is not a man, that He should lie, nor a son of man, that He should change His mind. Has He said, and will He not do it? Or has He spoken, and will He not fulfill it?

original: הִנֵּ֥ה  וּבֵרֵ֖ךְ  וְלֹ֥א  אֲשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃
translation: Behold, I have received a command to bless; He has blessed, and I cannot revoke it.

original: לֹֽא־ הִבִּ֥יט  אָ֨וֶן֙  בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב  וְלֹא־ רָאָ֥ה  עָמָ֖ל  בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל  יְהוָ֤ה  אֱלֹהָיו֙  עִמּ֔וֹ  וּתְרוּעַ֥ת  מֶ֖לֶךְ  בּֽוֹ׃
translation: He has not looked upon iniquity in Jacob, nor has He seen trouble in Israel. The LORD his God is with him, and the shout of a king is among them.

original: אֵ֖ל  מוֹצִיאָ֣ם  מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם  כְּתוֹעֲפֹ֥ת  רְאֵ֖ם  לֽוֹ׃
translation: God, who brought them out of Egypt, is like the majestic strength of a wild ox.

original: כִּ֤י  לֹא־ נַ֨חַשׁ֙  בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב  וְלֹא־ קֶ֖סֶם  בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל  כָּעֵ֗ת  יֵאָמֵ֤ר  לְיַעֲקֹב֙  וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל  מַה־ פָּ֖עַל  אֵֽל׃
translation: For there is no divination in Jacob, nor is there sorcery in Israel. At this time it shall be said to Jacob and to Israel, "What has God done?"

original: הֶן־ עָם֙  כְּלָבִ֣יא  יָק֔וּם  וְכַאֲרִ֖י  יִתְנַשָּׂ֑א  עַד־ יֹ֣אכַל  טֶ֔רֶף  וְדַם־ חֲלָלִ֖ים  יִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
translation: Behold, a people will rise like a lioness, and like a lion will he lift himself up; he will not lie down until he devours prey and drinks the blood of the slain.

original: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  בָּלָק֙  אֶל־ בִּלְעָ֔ם  גַּם־ קֹ֖ב  לֹ֣א  תִקֳּבֶ֑נּוּ  גַּם־ בָּרֵ֖ךְ  לֹ֥א  תְבָרֲכֶֽנּוּ׃
translation: And Balak said to Balaam, "You shall not curse them at all, nor shall you bless them at all."

original: וַיַּ֣עַן  בִּלְעָ֔ם  וַיֹּ֖אמֶר  אֶל־ בָּלָ֑ק  הֲלֹ֗א  דִּבַּ֤רְתִּי  אֵלֶ֨יךָ֙  לֵאמֹ֔ר  כֹּ֛ל  אֲשֶׁר־ יְדַבֵּ֥ר  יְהוָ֖ה  אֹת֥וֹ
translation: And Balaam answered and said to Balak, “Did I not speak to you, saying, ‘All that the LORD speaks, that I must do’?”

original: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  בָּלָק֙  אֶל־ בִּלְעָ֔ם  לְכָה־ נָּא֙  אֶקָּ֣חֲךָ֔  אֶל־ מָק֖וֹם  אַחֵ֑ר  אוּלַ֤י  יִישַׁר֙  בְּעֵינֵ֣י  הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים  וְקַבֹּ֥תוֹ  לִ֖י  מִשָּֽׁם׃
translation: And Balak said to Balaam, "Please come, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will be pleasing in the eyes of God, and you will curse them for me from there."

original: גַּ֤ם  כָּל־ חֳלִי֙  וְכָל־ מַכָּ֔ה  אֲשֶׁר֙  לֹ֣א  כָת֔וּב  בְּסֵ֖פֶר  הַתּוֹרָ֣ה  הַזֹּ֑את  עָלֶ֔יךָ  עַ֖ד  הִשָּׁמְדָֽךְ׃
translation: Also, every illness and every wound that is not written in the book of this Torah shall come upon you until you are destroyed.

original: וְבִּמְתֵ֣י  מְעָ֔ט  תַּ֚חַת  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  הֱיִיתֶ֔ם  כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י  הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם  לָרֹ֑ב  כִּי־ לֹ֣א  שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ  בְּק֖וֹל  יְהוָ֥ה  אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
translation: And you shall remain few in number, whereas you were as numerous as the stars of the heavens, because you did not obey the voice of the LORD your God.

original: וְ֠הָיָה  כַּאֲשֶׁר־ שָׂ֨שׂ  יְהוָ֜ה  עֲלֵיכֶ֗ם  לְהֵיטִ֣יב  אֶתְכֶם֮  וּלְהַרְבּ֣וֹת  אֶתְכֶם֒  כֵּ֣ן  יָשִׂ֤ישׂ  יְהוָה֙  עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם  לְהַאֲבִ֥יד  אֶתְכֶ֖ם  וּלְהַשְׁמִ֣יד  אֶתְכֶ֑ם  וְנִסַּחְתֶּם֙  מֵעַ֣ל  הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה  אֲשֶׁר־ אַתָּ֥ה  בָא־ שָׁ֖מָּה  לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
translation: And it shall come to pass, as the LORD rejoiced over you to do you good and to multiply you, so the LORD will rejoice over you to destroy you and to annihilate you, and you shall be uprooted from the land which you are entering to possess.

original: וֶהֱפִֽיצְךָ֤  יְהוָה֙  בְּכָל־ הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים  מִקְצֵ֥ה  הָאָ֖רֶץ  וְעַד־ קְצֵ֣ה  הָאָ֑רֶץ  וְעָבַ֨דְתָּ  שָּׁ֜ם  אֱלֹהִ֣ים  אֲחֵרִ֗ים  אֲשֶׁ֧ר  לֹא־ יָדַ֛עְתָּ  אַתָּ֥ה  וַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ  עֵ֥ץ  וָאָֽבֶן׃
translation: And the LORD will scatter you among all the peoples, from one end of the earth to the other, and there you will serve other gods—gods of wood and stone—which you have not known, neither you nor your fathers.

original: וּבַגּוֹיִ֤ם  הָהֵם֙  לֹ֣א  תַרְגִּ֔יעַ  וְלֹא־ יִהְיֶ֥ה  מָנ֖וֹחַ  לְכַף־ רַגְלֶ֑ךָ  וְנָתַן֩  יְהוָ֨ה  לְךָ֥  שָׁם֙  לֵ֣ב  רַגָּ֔ז  וְכִלְי֥וֹן  עֵינַ֖יִם  וְדַֽאֲב֥וֹן  נָֽפֶשׁ׃
translation: And among those nations you shall find no rest, nor shall there be a resting place for the sole of your foot. And the LORD will give you there a trembling heart, failing of eyes, and despair of soul.

original: וְהָי֣וּ  חַיֶּ֔יךָ  תְּלֻאִ֥ים  לְךָ֖  מִנֶּ֑גֶד  וּפָֽחַדְתָּ֙  לַ֣יְלָה  וְיוֹמָ֔ם  וְלֹ֥א  תַאֲמִ֖ין  בְּחַיֶּֽיךָ׃
translation: And your life shall hang in suspense before you, and you shall be in dread night and day, and you shall have no confidence in your life.

original: בַּבֹּ֤קֶר  תֹּאמַר֙  מִֽי־ יִתֵּ֣ן  עֶ֔רֶב  וּבָעֶ֥רֶב  תֹּאמַ֖ר  מִֽי־ יִתֵּ֣ן  בֹּ֑קֶר  מִפַּ֤חַד  לְבָֽבְךָ֙  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  תִּפְחָ֔ד  וּמִמַּרְאֵ֥ה  עֵינֶ֖יךָ  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  תִּרְאֶֽה׃
translation: In the morning you will say, “Who will grant evening?” and in the evening you will say, “Who will grant morning?”—because of the dread in your heart, which you will dread, and because of the sight of your eyes, which you will see.

original: וֶֽהֱשִֽׁיבְךָ֨יְהוָ֥ה׀ מִצְרַיִם֮  בָּאֳנִיּוֹת֒  בַּדֶּ֨רֶךְ֙  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  אָמַ֣רְתִּֽי  לְךָ֔  לֹא־ תֹסִ֥יף  ע֖וֹד  לִרְאֹתָ֑הּ  וְהִתְמַכַּרְתֶּ֨ם  שָׁ֧ם  לְאֹיְבֶ֛יךָ  לַעֲבָדִ֥ים  וְלִשְׁפָח֖וֹת  וְאֵ֥ין  קֹנֶֽה׃ס
translation: And the LORD will return you to Egypt in ships, by the way of which I said to you, “You shall not see it again.” And there you will offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male slaves and female slaves, but there will be no buyer.

original: אֵלֶּה֩  דִבְרֵ֨י  הַבְּרִ֜ית  אֲֽשֶׁר־ צִוָּ֧ה  יְהוָ֣ה  אֶת־ מֹשֶׁ֗ה  לִכְרֹ֛ת  אֶת־ בְּנֵ֥י  יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל  בְּאֶ֣רֶץ  מוֹאָ֑ב  מִלְּבַ֣ד  הַבְּרִ֔ית  אֲשֶׁר־ כָּרַ֥ת  אִתָּ֖ם  בְּחֹרֵֽב׃פ
translation: These are the words of the covenant that the LORD commanded Moses to establish with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant that He made with them at Horeb.

original: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר  ל֜וֹ  אָבִ֣יו  וְאִמּ֗וֹ  אֵין֩  בִּבְנ֨וֹת  אַחֶ֤יךָ  וּבְכָל־ עַמִּי֙  אִשָּׁ֔ה  כִּֽי־ אַתָּ֤ה  הוֹלֵךְ֙  לָקַ֣חַת  אִשָּׁ֔ה  מִפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים  הָעֲרֵלִ֑ים  וַיֹּ֨אמֶר  שִׁמְשׁ֤וֹן  אֶל־ אָבִיו֙  אוֹתָ֣הּ  קַֽח־ לִ֔י  כִּֽי־ הִ֖יא  יָשְׁרָ֥ה  בְעֵינָֽי׃
translation: And his father and his mother said to him, "Is there no woman among the daughters of your brothers or among all my people, that you are going to take a wife from the uncircumcised Philistines?" But Samson said to his father, "Take her for me, for she is right in my eyes."

original: וְאָבִ֨יו  וְאִמּ֜וֹ  לֹ֣א  יָדְע֗וּ  כִּ֤י  מֵיְהוָה֙  הִ֔יא  כִּי־ תֹאֲנָ֥ה  הֽוּא־ מְבַקֵּ֖שׁ  מִפְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים  וּבָעֵ֣ת  הַהִ֔יא  פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים  מֹשְׁלִ֥ים  בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃פ
translation: And his father and his mother did not know that it was from the LORD, for he was seeking an opportunity against the Philistines. Now at that time, the Philistines were ruling over Israel.

original: וַיֵּ֧רֶד  שִׁמְשׁ֛וֹן  וְאָבִ֥יו  וְאִמּ֖וֹ  תִּמְנָ֑תָה  וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ֙  עַד־ כַּרְמֵ֣י  תִמְנָ֔תָה  וְהִנֵּה֙  כְּפִ֣יר  אֲרָי֔וֹת  לִקְרָאתֽוֹ׃
translation: And Samson went down, he and his father and his mother, to Timnah. And they came to the vineyards of Timnah, and behold, a young lion came to meet him.

original: וַתִּצְלַ֨ח  עָלָ֜יו  ר֣וּחַ  יְהוָ֗ה  וַֽיְשַׁסְּעֵ֨הוּ֙  כְּשַׁסַּ֣ע  הַגְּדִ֔י  וּמְא֖וּמָה  אֵ֣ין  בְּיָד֑וֹ  וְלֹ֤א  הִגִּיד֙  לְאָבִ֣יו  וּלְאִמּ֔וֹ  אֵ֖ת  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  עָשָֽׂה׃
translation: And the Spirit of the LORD rushed upon him mightily, and he tore it apart as one tears apart a young goat, though there was nothing in his hand. And he did not tell his father or his mother what he had done.

original: וַיֵּ֖רֶד  וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר  לָאִשָּׁ֑ה  וַתִּישַׁ֖ר  בְּעֵינֵ֥י  שִׁמְשֽׁוֹן׃
translation: And he went down and spoke to the woman, and she was pleasing in the eyes of Samson.

original: וַיָּ֤שָׁב  מִיָּמִים֙  לְקַחְתָּ֔הּ  וַיָּ֣סַר  לִרְא֔וֹת  אֵ֖ת  מַפֶּ֣לֶת  הָאַרְיֵ֑ה  וְהִנֵּ֨ה  עֲדַ֧ת  דְּבוֹרִ֛ים  בִּגְוִיַּ֥ת  הָאַרְיֵ֖ה  וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
translation: And he returned after some days to take her, and he turned aside to see the carcass of the lion. And behold, a swarm of bees was in the carcass of the lion, and honey.

original: וַיִּרְדֵּ֣הוּ  אֶל־ כַּפָּ֗יו  וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ  הָלוֹךְ֙  וְאָכֹ֔ל  וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ֙  אֶל־ אָבִ֣יו  וְאֶל־ אִמּ֔וֹ  וַיִּתֵּ֥ן  לָהֶ֖ם  וַיֹּאכֵ֑לוּ  וְלֹֽא־ הִגִּ֣יד  לָהֶ֔ם  כִּ֛י  מִגְּוִיַּ֥ת  הָאַרְיֵ֖ה  רָדָ֥ה  הַדְּבָֽשׁ׃
translation: And he scraped it into his hands and went on, eating as he went. Then he came to his father and mother, gave it to them, and they ate. But he did not tell them that he had scraped the honey from the carcass of the lion.

original: וַתְּהִ֖י  אֵ֣שֶׁת  שִׁמְשׁ֑וֹן  לְמֵ֣רֵעֵ֔הוּ  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  רֵעָ֖ה  לֽוֹ׃
translation: And Samson’s wife became his companion’s, who had been his companion.

original: וַיְהִ֨י  מִיָּמִ֜ים  בִּימֵ֣י  קְצִיר־ חִטִּ֗ים  וַיִּפְקֹ֨ד  שִׁמְשׁ֤וֹן  אֶת־ אִשְׁתּוֹ֙  בִּגְדִ֣י  עִזִּ֔ים  וַיֹּ֕אמֶר  אָבֹ֥אָה  אֶל־ אִשְׁתִּ֖י  הֶחָ֑דְרָה  וְלֹֽא־ נְתָנ֥וֹ  אָבִ֖יהָ  לָבֽוֹא׃
translation: And it came to pass after some days, in the days of the wheat harvest, that Samson visited his wife with a young goat, and he said, "I will go in to my wife, into the chamber." But her father did not permit him to go in.

original: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  שְׁמוּאֵל֙  אֵ֣יךְ  אֵלֵ֔ךְ  וְשָׁמַ֥ע  שָׁא֖וּל  וַהֲרָגָ֑נִיס וַיֹּ֣אמֶר  יְהוָ֗ה  עֶגְלַ֤ת  בָּקָר֙  תִּקַּ֣ח  בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ  וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔  לִזְבֹּ֥חַ  לַֽיהוָ֖ה  בָּֽאתִי׃
translation: And Samuel said, “How shall I go? For Saul will hear of it and kill me.” And the LORD said, “Take a heifer in your hand, and say, ‘I have come to sacrifice to the LORD.’”

original: וְקָרָ֥אתָ  לְיִשַׁ֖י  בַּזָּ֑בַח  וְאָֽנֹכִ֗י  אוֹדִֽיעֲךָ֙  אֵ֣ת  אֲשֶֽׁר־ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה  וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֣  לִ֔י  אֵ֥ת  אֲשֶׁר־ אֹמַ֖ר  אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
translation: And you shall call to Jesse at the sacrifice, and I will make known to you what you shall do. And you shall anoint for me the one whom I say to you.

original: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ  שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל  אֵ֚ת  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  דִּבֶּ֣ר  יְהוָ֔ה  וַיָּבֹ֖א  בֵּ֣ית  לָ֑חֶם  וַיֶּחֶרְד֞וּ  זִקְנֵ֤י  הָעִיר֙  לִקְרָאת֔וֹ  וַיֹּ֖אמֶר  שָׁלֹ֥ם  בּוֹאֶֽךָ׃
translation: And Samuel did as the LORD had spoken, and he came to Bethlehem. And the elders of the city trembled as they went out to meet him, and he said, “Peace be upon your coming.”

original: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר׀ לִזְבֹּ֤חַ  לַֽיהוָה֙  בָּ֔אתִי  הִֽתְקַדְּשׁ֔וּ  וּבָאתֶ֥ם  אִתִּ֖י  בַּזָּ֑בַח  וַיְקַדֵּ֤שׁ  אֶת־ יִשַׁי֙  וְאֶת־ בָּנָ֔יו  וַיִּקְרָ֥א  לָהֶ֖ם  לַזָּֽבַח׃
translation: And he said, “I have come to sacrifice to the LORD. Consecrate yourselves and come with me to the sacrifice.” And he consecrated Jesse and his sons, and he called them to the sacrifice.

original: וַיְהִ֣י  בְּבוֹאָ֔ם  וַיַּ֖רְא  אֶת־ אֱלִיאָ֑ב  וַיֹּ֕אמֶר  אַ֛ךְ  נֶ֥גֶד  יְהוָ֖ה  מְשִׁיחֽוֹ׃
translation: And it came to pass, when they came, that he saw Eliab and said, "Surely before the LORD is His anointed."

original: וַיַּעַן֩  אֶחָ֨ד  מֵהַנְּעָרִ֜ים  וַיֹּ֗אמֶר  הִנֵּ֨ה  בֵּ֣ן  לְיִשַׁי֮  בֵּ֣ית  הַלַּחְמִי֒  יֹדֵ֣עַ  נַ֠גֵּן  וְגִבּ֨וֹר  חַ֜יִל  וְאִ֧ישׁ  מִלְחָמָ֛ה  וּנְב֥וֹן  דָּבָ֖ר  וְאִ֣ישׁ  תֹּ֑אַר  וַיהוָ֖ה  עִמּֽוֹ׃
translation: And one of the young men answered and said, “Behold, a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite, skilled in playing music, and a mighty man of valor, and a man of war, and prudent in speech, and a man of handsome appearance, and the LORD is with him.”

original: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח  שָׁא֛וּל  מַלְאָכִ֖ים  אֶל־ יִשָׁ֑י  וַיֹּ֕אמֶר  שִׁלְחָ֥ה  אֵלַ֛י  אֶת־ דָּוִ֥ד  בִּנְךָ֖  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  בַּצֹּֽאן׃
translation: And Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and he said, “Send to me David your son, who is with the flock.”

original: וַיִּקַּ֨ח  יִשַׁ֜י  חֲמ֥וֹר  לֶ֨חֶם֙  וְנֹ֣אד  יַ֔יִן  וּגְדִ֥י  עִזִּ֖ים  אֶחָ֑ד  וַיִּשְׁלַ֛ח  בְּיַד־ דָּוִ֥ד  בְּנ֖וֹ  אֶל־ שָׁאֽוּל׃
translation: And Jesse took a donkey loaded with bread, a wineskin of wine, and one young goat from the flock, and he sent them by the hand of David his son to Saul.

original: וַיָּבֹ֤א  דָוִד֙  אֶל־ שָׁא֔וּל  וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד  לְפָנָ֑יו  וַיֶּאֱהָבֵ֣הֽוּ  מְאֹ֔ד  וַֽיְהִי־ ל֖וֹ  נֹשֵׂ֥א  כֵלִֽים׃
translation: And David came to Saul and stood before him. And he loved him greatly, and he became his armor-bearer.

original: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח  שָׁא֔וּל  אֶל־ יִשַׁ֖י  לֵאמֹ֑ר  יַעֲמָד־ נָ֤א  דָוִד֙  לְפָנַ֔י  כִּֽי־ מָ֥צָא  חֵ֖ן  בְּעֵינָֽי׃
translation: And Saul sent to Jesse, saying, “Let David, I pray you, stand before me, for he has found favor in my eyes.”

original: וְהָיָ֗ה  בִּֽהְי֤וֹת  רֽוּחַ־ אֱלֹהִים֙  אֶל־ שָׁא֔וּל  וְלָקַ֥ח  דָּוִ֛ד  אֶת־ הַכִּנּ֖וֹר  וְנִגֵּ֣ן  בְּיָד֑וֹ  וְרָוַ֤ח  לְשָׁאוּל֙  וְט֣וֹב  ל֔וֹ  וְסָ֥רָה  מֵעָלָ֖יו  ר֥וּחַ  הָרָעָֽה׃פ
translation: And it came to pass, when the Spirit of God was upon Saul, that David took the harp and played it with his hand. Then Saul was refreshed, and it was well with him, and the evil spirit departed from him.

original: וְצִוָּ֤ה  אֵלָיו֙  עַל־ הַדָּבָ֣ר  הַזֶּ֔ה  לְבִ֨לְתִּי־ לֶ֔כֶת  אַחֲרֵ֖י  אֱלֹהִ֣ים  אֲחֵרִ֑ים  וְלֹ֣א  שָׁמַ֔ר  אֵ֥ת  אֲשֶׁר־ צִוָּ֖ה  יְהוָֽה׃פ
translation: And He commanded him concerning this matter, so as not to go after other gods. But he did not keep what the LORD had commanded.

original: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר  יְהוָ֜ה  לִשְׁלֹמֹ֗ה  יַ֚עַן  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  הָֽיְתָה־ זֹּ֣את  עִמָּ֔ךְ  וְלֹ֤א  שָׁמַ֨רְתָּ֙  בְּרִיתִ֣י  וְחֻקֹּתַ֔י  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  צִוִּ֖יתִי  עָלֶ֑יךָ  קָרֹ֨עַ  אֶקְרַ֤ע  אֶת־ הַמַּמְלָכָה֙  מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ  וּנְתַתִּ֖יהָ  לְעַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
translation: And the LORD said to Solomon, "Because this has been with you, and you have not kept My covenant and My statutes, which I commanded upon you, I will surely tear the kingdom from you and give it to your servant."

original: אַךְ־ בְּיָמֶ֨יךָ֙  לֹ֣א  אֶעֱשֶׂ֔נָּה  לְמַ֖עַן  דָּוִ֣ד  אָבִ֑יךָ  מִיַּ֥ד  בִּנְךָ֖  אֶקְרָעֶֽנָּה׃
translation: Only in your days will I not do it, for the sake of David your father; from the hand of your son I will tear it away.

original: רַ֤ק  אֶת־ כָּל־ הַמַּמְלָכָה֙  לֹ֣א  אֶקְרָ֔ע  שֵׁ֥בֶט  אֶחָ֖ד  אֶתֵּ֣ן  לִבְנֶ֑ךָ  לְמַ֨עַן֙  דָּוִ֣ד  עַבְדִּ֔י  וּלְמַ֥עַן  יְרוּשָׁלִַ֖ם  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  בָּחָֽרְתִּי׃
translation: Only the entire kingdom I will not tear apart; one tribe I will give to your son, for the sake of David, My servant, and for the sake of Jerusalem, which I have chosen.

original: וַלִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה  אֵ֖ת  הֲדַ֣ד  הָאֲדֹמִ֑י  מִזֶּ֧רַע  הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ  ה֖וּא  בֶּאֱדֽוֹם׃
translation: And to Solomon, Hadad the Edomite, from the seed of the king—he was in Edom.

original: וַיְהִ֗י  בִּֽהְי֤וֹת  דָּוִד֙  אֶת־ אֱד֔וֹם  בַּעֲל֗וֹת  יוֹאָב֙  שַׂ֣ר  הַצָּבָ֔א  לְקַבֵּ֖ר  אֶת־ הַחֲלָלִ֑ים  וַיַּ֥ךְ  כָּל־ זָכָ֖ר  בֶּאֱדֽוֹם׃
translation: And it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab, the commander of the army, went up to bury the slain, that he struck down every male in Edom.

original: כִּ֣י  שֵׁ֧שֶׁת  חֳדָשִׁ֛ים  יוֹאָ֖ב  וְכָל־ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל  עַד־ הִכְרִ֥ית  כָּל־ זָכָ֖ר  בֶּאֱדֽוֹם׃
translation: For six months Joab and all Israel remained there until he had destroyed every male in Edom.

original: וַיִּבְרַ֣ח  אֲדַ֡ד  הוּא֩  וַאֲנָשִׁ֨ים  אֲדֹמִיִּ֜ים  מֵעַבְדֵ֥י  אָבִ֛יו  אִתּ֖וֹ  לָב֣וֹא  מִצְרָ֑יִם  וַהֲדַ֖ד  נַ֥עַר  קָטָֽן׃
translation: And Hadad fled—he and certain Edomites from his father’s servants with him—to go to Egypt. Now Hadad was a young man, small in stature.

original: וַיָּקֻ֨מוּ֙  מִמִּדְיָ֔ן  וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ  פָּארָ֑ן  וַיִּקְחוּ֩  אֲנָשִׁ֨ים  עִמָּ֜ם  מִפָּארָ֗ן  וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ  מִצְרַ֨יִם֙  אֶל־ פַּרְעֹ֣ה  מֶֽלֶךְ־ מִצְרַ֔יִם  וַיִּתֶּן־ ל֣וֹ  בַ֗יִת  וְלֶ֨חֶם֙  אָ֣מַר  ל֔וֹ  וְאֶ֖רֶץ  נָ֥תַן  לֽוֹ׃
translation: And they arose from Midian and came to Paran. And they took men with them from Paran and came to Egypt, to Pharaoh, king of Egypt. And he gave him a house and bread; he said to him, and land he gave to him.

original: וַיִּמְצָא֙  הֲדַ֥ד  חֵ֛ן  בְּעֵינֵ֥י  פַרְעֹ֖ה  מְאֹ֑ד  וַיִּתֶּן־ ל֤וֹ  אִשָּׁה֙  אֶת־ אֲח֣וֹת  אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ  אֲח֖וֹת  תַּחְפְּנֵ֥יס  הַגְּבִירָֽה׃
translation: And Hadad found great favor in the eyes of Pharaoh, so that he gave him as a wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.

original: וַחֲמִשִּׁ֨ים  אִ֜ישׁ  מִבְּנֵ֤י  הַנְּבִיאִים֙  הָֽלְכ֔וּ  וַיַּעַמְד֥וּ  מִנֶּ֖גֶד  מֵרָח֑וֹק  וּשְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם  עָמְד֥וּ  עַל־ הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
translation: And fifty men from the sons of the prophets went and stood at a distance opposite, while the two of them stood by the Jordan.

original: וַיִּקַּח֩  אֵלִיָּ֨הוּ  אֶת־ אַדַּרְתּ֤וֹ  וַיִּגְלֹם֙  וַיַּכֶּ֣ה  אֶת־ הַמַּ֔יִם  וַיֵּחָצ֖וּ  הֵ֣נָּה  וָהֵ֑נָּה  וַיַּעַבְר֥וּ  שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם  בֶּחָרָבָֽה׃
translation: And Elijah took his cloak and rolled it up, and he struck the waters, and they were divided here and there, and the two of them crossed on dry ground.

original: וַיְהִ֣י  כְעָבְרָ֗ם  וְאֵ֨לִיָּ֜הוּ  אָמַ֤ר  אֶל־ אֱלִישָׁע֙  שְׁאַל֙  לָּ֔ךְ  בְּטֶ֖רֶם  אֶלָּקַ֣ח  מֵעִמָּ֑ךְ  וַיֹּ֣אמֶר  אֱלִישָׁ֔ע  וִֽיהִי־ נָ֛א  פִּֽי־ שְׁנַ֥יִם  בְּרוּחֲךָ֖  אֵלָֽי׃
translation: And it came to pass, as they were crossing over, that Elijah said to Elisha, “Ask what I may do for you before I am taken from you.” And Elisha said, “Let there be, I pray you, a double portion of your spirit upon me.”

original: וִיהוֹרָ֣ם  בֶּן־ אַחְאָ֗ב  מָלַ֤ךְ  עַל־ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙  בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן  בִּשְׁנַת֙  שְׁמֹנֶ֣ה  עֶשְׂרֵ֔ה  לִיהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט  מֶ֣לֶךְ  יְהוּדָ֑ה  וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ  שְׁתֵּים־ עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה  שָׁנָֽה׃
translation: And Jehoram, the son of Ahab, became king over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat, king of Judah, and he reigned twelve years.

original: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר  מֶ֣לֶךְ  יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל  אֲהָ֕הּ  קָרָ֣א  יְהוָ֗ה  לִשְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת֙הַמְּלָכִ֣ים  הָאֵ֔לֶּה  לָתֵ֥ת  אוֹתָ֖ם  בְּיַד־ מוֹאָֽב׃
translation: And the king of Israel said, “Alas, the LORD has called these three kings to give them into the hand of Moab.”

original: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר  יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט  הַאֵ֨ין  פֹּ֤ה  נָבִיא֙  לַֽיהוָ֔ה  וְנִדְרְשָׁ֥ה  אֶת־ יְהוָ֖ה  מֵאוֹת֑וֹ  וַ֠יַּעַן  אֶחָ֞ד  מֵעַבְדֵ֤י  מֶֽלֶךְ־ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙  וַיֹּ֔אמֶר  פֹּ֚ה  אֱלִישָׁ֣ע  בֶּן־ שָׁפָ֔ט  אֲשֶׁר־ יָ֥צַק  מַ֖יִם  עַל־ יְדֵ֥י  אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
translation: And Jehoshaphat said, "Is there not here a prophet of the LORD, that we may inquire of the LORD from him?" And one of the servants of the king of Israel answered and said, "Here is Elisha the son of Shaphat, who poured water on the hands of Elijah."

original: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר֙  יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט  יֵ֥שׁ  אוֹת֖וֹ  דְּבַר־ יְהוָ֑ה  וַיֵּרְד֣וּ  אֵלָ֗יו  מֶ֧לֶךְ  יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל  וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט  וּמֶ֥לֶךְ  אֱדֽוֹם׃
translation: And Jehoshaphat said, “Is there not here a word of the LORD?” So the king of Israel, Jehoshaphat, and the king of Edom went down to him.

original: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר  אֱלִישָׁ֜ע  אֶל־ מֶ֤לֶךְ  יִשְׂרָאֵל֙  מַה־ לִּ֣י  וָלָ֔ךְ  לֵ֚ךְ  אֶל־ נְבִיאֵ֣י  אָבִ֔יךָ  וְאֶל־ נְבִיאֵ֖י  אִמֶּ֑ךָ  וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  לוֹ֙  מֶ֣לֶךְ  יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל  כִּֽי־ קָרָ֤א  יְהוָה֙  לִשְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת֙  הַמְּלָכִ֣ים  הָאֵ֔לֶּה  לָתֵ֥ת  אוֹתָ֖ם  בְּיַד־ מוֹאָֽב׃
translation: And Elisha said to the king of Israel, “What is there between me and you? Go to the prophets of your father and to the prophets of your mother.” But the king of Israel said to him, “No, for the LORD has summoned these three kings to give them into the hand of Moab.”

original: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר  אֱלִישָׁ֗ע  יְהוָ֤ה  צְבָאוֹת֙  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  עָמַ֣דְתִּי  לְפָנָ֔יו  כִּ֗י  לוּלֵ֛י  פְּנֵ֛י  יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט  מֶֽלֶךְ־ יְהוּדָ֖ה  אֲנִ֣י  נֹשֵׂ֑א  אִם־ אַבִּ֥יט  אֵלֶ֖יךָ  וְאִם־ אֶרְאֶֽךָּ׃
translation: And Elisha said, “As the LORD of hosts lives, before whom I have stood, were it not for the regard of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, I would not look at you, nor would I see you.”

original: וְעַתָּ֖ה  קְחוּ־ לִ֣י  מְנַגֵּ֑ן  וְהָיָה֙  כְּנַגֵּ֣ן  הַֽמְנַגֵּ֔ן  וַתְּהִ֥י  עָלָ֖יו  יַד־ יְהוָֽה׃
translation: And now, take for me a musician. And it came to pass, when the musician played, that the hand of the LORD came upon him.

original: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר  כֹּ֖ה  אָמַ֣ר  יְהוָ֑ה  עָשֹׂ֛ה  הַנַּ֥חַל  הַזֶּ֖ה  גֵּבִ֥ים׀ גֵּבִֽים׃
translation: And he said, "Thus says the LORD: Make this valley full of ditches, ditches."

original: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים  נִלְחֲמ֣וּ  בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל  וַיָּ֑נָס  אִֽישׁ־ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙  מִפְּנֵ֣י  פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים  וַיִּפְּל֥וּ  חֲלָלִ֖ים  בְּהַ֥ר  גִּלְבֹּֽעַ׃
translation: And the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and the slain fell on Mount Gilboa.

original: וַיַּדְבְּק֣וּ  פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים  אַחֲרֵ֥י  שָׁא֖וּל  וְאַחֲרֵ֣י  בָנָ֑יו  וַיַּכּ֣וּ  פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים  אֶת־ יוֹנָתָ֧ן  וְאֶת־ אֲבִינָדָ֛ב  וְאֶת־ מַלְכִּי־ שׁ֖וּעַ  בְּנֵ֥י  שָׁאֽוּל׃
translation: And the Philistines pursued after Saul and after his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.

original: וַתִּכְבַּ֤ד  הַמִּלְחָמָה֙  עַל־ שָׁא֔וּל  וַיִּמְצָאֻ֖הוּ  הַמּוֹרִ֣ים  בַּקָּ֑שֶׁת  וַיָּ֖חֶל  מִן־ הַיּוֹרִֽים׃
translation: And the war grew heavy upon Saul, and the archers found him with the bow, and he was wounded by the shooters.

original: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר  שָׁאוּל֩  אֶל־ נֹשֵׂ֨א  כֵלָ֜יו  שְׁלֹ֥ף  חַרְבְּךָ֣׀ וְדָקְרֵ֣נִי  בָ֗הּ  פֶּן־ יָבֹ֜אוּ  הָעֲרֵלִ֤ים  הָאֵ֨לֶּה֙  וְהִתְעַלְּלוּ־ בִ֔י  וְלֹ֤א  אָבָה֙  נֹשֵׂ֣א  כֵלָ֔יו  כִּ֥י  יָרֵ֖א  מְאֹ֑דס וַיִּקַּ֤ח  שָׁאוּל֙  אֶת־ הַחֶ֔רֶב  וַיִּפֹּ֖ל  עָלֶֽיהָ׃
translation: And Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and pierce me through with it, lest these uncircumcised men come and abuse me.” But his armor-bearer would not, for he was greatly afraid. So Saul took the sword and fell upon it.

original: וַיַּ֥רְא  נֹשֵֽׂא־ כֵלָ֖יו  כִּ֣י  מֵ֣ת  שָׁא֑וּל  וַיִּפֹּ֥ל  גַּם־ ה֛וּא  עַל־ הַחֶ֖רֶב  וַיָּמֹֽת׃ס
translation: And his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, and he also fell upon his sword and died.

original: וַיָּ֤מָת  שָׁאוּל֙  וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת  בָּנָ֔יו  וְכָל־ בֵּית֖וֹ  יַחְדָּ֥ו  מֵֽתוּ׃
translation: And Saul died, and his three sons, and all his house died together.

original: וַ֠יִּרְאוּ  כָּל־ אִ֨ישׁ  יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל  אֲשֶׁר־ בָּעֵ֨מֶק֙  כִּ֣י  נָ֔סוּ  וְכִי־ מֵ֖תוּ  שָׁא֣וּל  וּבָנָ֑יו  וַיַּעַזְב֤וּ  עָרֵיהֶם֙  וַיָּנֻ֔סוּ  וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ  פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים  וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ  בָּהֶֽם׃ס
translation: And all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they had fled and that Saul and his sons had died. So they abandoned their cities and fled, and the Philistines came and settled in them.

original: וַיָּשִׂ֨ימוּ֙  אֶת־ כֵּלָ֔יו  בֵּ֖ית  אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם  וְאֶת־ גֻּלְגָּלְתּ֥וֹ  תָקְע֖וּ  בֵּ֥ית  דָּגֽוֹן׃ס
translation: And they placed his equipment in the house of their god, and they fastened his skull in the house of Dagon.

original: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֔וּ  כֹּ֖ל  יָבֵ֣ישׁ  גִּלְעָ֑ד  אֵ֛ת  כָּל־ אֲשֶׁר־ עָשׂ֥וּ  פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים  לְשָׁאֽוּל׃
translation: And all the inhabitants of Jabesh-Gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul.

original: וַיָּקוּמוּ֮  כָּל־ אִ֣ישׁ  חַיִל֒  וַיִּשְׂא֞וּ  אֶת־ גּוּפַ֣ת  שָׁא֗וּל  וְאֵת֙  גּוּפֹ֣ת  בָּנָ֔יו  וַיְבִיא֖וּם  יָבֵ֑ישָׁה  וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ  אֶת־ עַצְמוֹתֵיהֶ֜ם  תַּ֤חַת  הָאֵלָה֙  בְּיָבֵ֔שׁ  וַיָּצ֖וּמוּ  שִׁבְעַ֥ת  יָמִֽים׃
translation: And all the men of valor arose, and they took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh. They buried their bones under the terebinth tree in Jabesh, and they fasted seven days.

original: וַיָּ֣מָת  שָׁא֗וּל  בְּמַֽעֲלוֹ֙  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  מָעַ֣ל  בַּֽיהוָ֔ה  עַל־ דְּבַ֥ר  יְהוָ֖ה  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  לֹא־ שָׁמָ֑ר  וְגַם־ לִשְׁא֥וֹל  בָּא֖וֹב  לִדְרֽוֹשׁ׃
translation: And Saul died because of the transgression which he committed against the LORD, concerning the word of the LORD which he did not keep, and also for consulting a medium to seek guidance.

original: וְלֹֽא־ דָרַ֥שׁ  בַּֽיהוָ֖ה  וַיְמִיתֵ֑הוּ  וַיַּסֵּב֙  אֶת־ הַמְּלוּכָ֔ה  לְדָוִ֖יד  בֶּן־ יִשָֽׁי׃פ
translation: And he did not seek the LORD, and he put him to death, and he turned the kingdom over to David, the son of Jesse.

original: וַיְהִ֕י  כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר  חָזְקָ֥ה  הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה  עָלָ֑יו  וַֽיַּהֲרֹג֙  אֶת־ עֲבָדָ֔יו  הַמַּכִּ֖ים  אֶת־ הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ  אָבִֽיו׃
translation: And it came to pass, when the kingdom was firmly established over him, that he killed his servants who had struck down the king, his father.

original: וְאֶת־ בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם  לֹ֣א  הֵמִ֑ית  כִּ֣י  כַכָּת֣וּב  בַּתּוֹרָ֡ה  בְּסֵ֣פֶר  מֹשֶׁה֩  אֲשֶׁר־ צִוָּ֨ה  יְהוָ֜ה  לֵאמֹ֗ר  לֹא־ יָמ֨וּתוּ  אָב֤וֹת  עַל־ בָּנִים֙  וּבָנִים֙  לֹא־ יָמ֣וּתוּ  עַל־ אָב֔וֹת  כִּ֛י  אִ֥ישׁ  בְּחֶטְא֖וֹ  יָמֽוּתוּ׃פ
translation: And their children they did not put to death, for as it is written in the Law, in the book of Moses, which the LORD commanded, saying, "Fathers shall not be put to death because of their children, nor shall children be put to death because of their fathers, for each person shall die for their own sin."

original: וַיִּקְבֹּ֤ץ  אֲמַצְיָ֨הוּ֙  אֶת־ יְהוּדָ֔ה  וַיַּֽעֲמִידֵ֣ם  לְבֵית־ אָב֗וֹת  לְשָׂרֵ֤י  הָאֲלָפִים֙  וּלְשָׂרֵ֣י  הַמֵּא֔וֹת  לְכָל־ יְהוּדָ֖ה  וּבִנְיָמִ֑ן  וַֽיִּפְקְדֵ֗ם  לְמִבֶּ֨ן  עֶשְׂרִ֤ים  שָׁנָה֙  וָמַ֔עְלָה  וַיִּמְצָאֵ֗ם  שְׁלֹשׁ־ מֵא֨וֹת  אֶ֤לֶף  בָּחוּר֙  יוֹצֵ֣א  צָבָ֔א  אֹחֵ֖ז  רֹ֥מַח  וְצִנָּֽה׃
translation: And Amaziah gathered Judah and appointed them according to their fathers' houses, under commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, for all Judah and Benjamin. He mustered them from twenty years old and upward and found them to be three hundred thousand choice men, fit for war, who could handle spear and shield.

original: וַיִּשְׂכֹּ֣ר  מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֗ל  מֵ֥אָה  אֶ֛לֶף  גִּבּ֥וֹר  חָ֖יִל  בְּמֵאָ֥ה  כִכַּר־ כָּֽסֶף׃
translation: And he hired from Israel one hundred thousand mighty men of valor for one hundred talents of silver.

original: וְאִ֣ישׁ  הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים  בָּ֤א  אֵלָיו֙  לֵאמֹ֔ר  הַמֶּ֕לֶךְ  כִּ֣י  אֵ֤ין  יְהוָה֙  עִם־ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל  כֹּ֖ל  בְּנֵ֥י  אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
translation: And the man of God came to him, saying, “O king, for the LORD is not with Israel, none of the sons of Ephraim.”

original: כִּ֚י  אִם־ בֹּ֣א  אַתָּ֔ה  חֲזַ֣ק  לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה  יַכְשִֽׁילְךָ֤  הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙  לִפְנֵ֣י  אוֹיֵ֔ב  כִּ֥י  יֶשׁ־ כֹּ֛חַ  בֵּאלֹהִ֖ים  לַעְז֥וֹר  וּלְהַכְשִֽׁיל׃
translation: For if you go, be strong for the battle, yet God will cause you to stumble before the enemy, for there is power in God both to help and to cause to stumble.

original: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר  אֲמַצְיָ֨הוּ֙  לְאִ֣ישׁ  הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים  וּמַֽה־ לַּעֲשׂוֹת֙  לִמְאַ֣ת  הַכִּכָּ֔ר  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  נָתַ֖תִּי  לִגְד֣וּד  יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל  וַיֹּ֨אמֶר֙  אִ֣ישׁ  הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים  יֵ֚שׁ  לַֽיהוָ֔ה  לָ֥תֶת  לְךָ֖  הַרְבֵּ֥ה  מִזֶּֽה׃
translation: And Amaziah said to the man of God, “But what about the hundred talents that I have given to the troops of Israel?” And the man of God said, “The LORD has the ability to give you much more than this.”

original: וַיִּקְח֞וּ  כָּל־ עַ֤ם  יְהוּדָה֙  אֶת־ עֻזִּיָּ֔הוּ  וְה֕וּא  בֶּן־ שֵׁ֥שׁ  עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה  שָׁנָ֑ה  וַיַּמְלִ֣יכוּ  אֹת֔וֹ  תַּ֖חַת  אָבִ֥יו  אֲמַצְיָֽהוּ׃
translation: And all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and they made him king in place of his father Amaziah.

original: וַיִּ֨בֶן  מִגְדָּלִ֜ים  בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר  וַיַּחְצֹב֙  בֹּר֣וֹת  רַבִּ֔ים  כִּ֤י  מִקְנֶה־ רַּב֙  הָ֣יָה  ל֔וֹ  וּבַשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה  וּבַמִּישׁ֑וֹר  אִכָּרִ֣ים  וְכֹֽרְמִ֗ים  בֶּהָרִים֙  וּבַכַּרְמֶ֔ל  כִּֽי־ אֹהֵ֥ב  אֲדָמָ֖ה  הָיָֽה׃ס
translation: And he built towers in the wilderness, and he hewed out many cisterns, for he had much livestock. And in the lowland and in the plain, there were farmers and vine-dressers; in the mountains and in Carmel, for he loved the land.

original: וַיְהִ֣י  לְעֻזִּיָּ֡הוּ  חַיִל֩  עֹשֵׂ֨ה  מִלְחָמָ֜ה  יוֹצְאֵ֧י  צָבָ֣א  לִגְד֗וּד  בְּמִסְפַּר֙  פְּקֻדָּתָ֔ם  בְּיַד֙  יְעִיאֵ֣ל  הַסּוֹפֵ֔ר  וּמַעֲשֵׂיָ֖הוּ  הַשּׁוֹטֵ֑ר  עַ֚ל  יַד־ חֲנַנְיָ֔הוּ  מִשָּׂרֵ֖י  הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
translation: And Uzziah had a force of warriors who went out to the army by troop, according to the number of their muster, under the direction of Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the authority of Hananiah, one of the king’s officials.

original: אִם־ יַ֭חְפֹּץ  לָרִ֣יב  עִמּ֑וֹ  אַחַ֥ת  מִנִּי־ אָֽלֶף׃
translation: If He desires to contend with him, not one in a thousand can answer Him.

original: אִם־ אֶ֭צְדָּק  פִּ֣י  תָּֽם־ אָ֝֗נִי  וַֽיַּעְקְשֵֽׁנִי׃
translation: If I am justified, my mouth is blameless; yet He has twisted me.

original: תָּֽם־ אָ֭נִי  לֹֽא־ אֵדַ֥ע  נַפְשִׁ֗י  אֶמְאַ֥ס  חַיָּֽי׃
translation: I am blameless; I do not know myself; I despise my life.

original: אַחַ֗ת  הִ֥יא  עַל־ כֵּ֥ן  אָמַ֑רְתִּי  תָּ֥ם  וְ֝רָשָׁ֗ע  ה֣וּא  מְכַלֶּֽה׃
translation: One thing it is; therefore I have said, "The blameless and the wicked He destroys."

original: אִם־ שׁ֭וֹט  יָמִ֣ית  פִּתְאֹ֑ם  לְמַסַּ֖ת  נְקִיִּ֣ם
translation:
If the scourge brings sudden death,  
it mocks the trial of the innocent.

original: אֶ֤רֶץ׀ נִתְּנָ֬ה  בְֽיַד־ רָשָׁ֗ע  פְּנֵֽי־ שֹׁפְטֶ֥יהָ  יְכַסֶּ֑ה  אִם־ לֹ֖א
translation: The land is given into the hand of the wicked; He covers the faces of its judges. If not—

original: וְיָמַ֣י  קַ֭לּוּ  מִנִּי־ רָ֑ץ  בָּֽ֝רְח֗וּ  לֹא־ רָא֥וּ  טוֹבָֽה׃
translation: And my days are swifter than a runner; they flee away, they see no good.

original: חָ֭לְפוּ  עִם־ אֳנִיּ֣וֹת  אֵבֶ֑ה  כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר  יָט֥וּשׂ  עֲלֵי־ אֹֽכֶל׃
translation: They pass by with ships of ebony, like an eagle swooping down upon its prey.

original: אִם־ אָ֭מְרִי  אֶשְׁכְּחָ֣ה  שִׂיחִ֑י  אֶעֶזְבָ֖ה  פָנַ֣י  וְאַבְלִֽיגָה׃
translation: If I say, "I will forget my complaint, I will put aside my countenance, and I will take courage."

original: יָגֹ֥רְתִּי  כָל־ עַצְּבֹתָ֑י  יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי  כִּי־ לֹ֥א  תְנַקֵּֽנִי׃
translation: I am afraid of all my sorrows; I know that You, O LORD, will not declare me innocent.

original: אָנֹכִ֥י  אֶרְשָׁ֑ע  לָמָּה־ זֶּ֝֗ה  הֶ֣בֶל  אִיגָֽע׃
translation: I am guilty; why then should I labor in vain?

original: אִם־ הִתְרָחַ֥צְתִּי  בְמֵי־ שָׁ֑לֶג  וַ֝הֲזִכּ֗וֹתִי  בְּבֹ֣ר  כַּפָּֽי׃
translation:
If I have washed myself with snow water,  
and purified my hands with cleansing soap.

original: אָ֭ז  בַּשַּׁ֣חַת  תִּטְבְּלֵ֑נִי  וְ֝תִֽעֲב֗וּנִי  שַׂלְמוֹתָֽי׃
translation:
Then in the pit You would plunge me,  
and my own garments would detest me.

original: כְּֽ֭דַעְתְּכֶם  יָדַ֣עְתִּי  גַם־ אָ֑נִי  לֹא־ נֹפֵ֖ל  אָנֹכִ֣י  מִכֶּֽם׃
translation: According to your knowledge, I also have known; I am not inferior to you.

original: גַּם־ הוּא־ לִ֥י  לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה  כִּי־ לֹ֥א  לְ֝פָנָ֗יו  חָנֵ֥ף  יָבֽוֹא׃
translation: He also is my salvation, for no hypocrite shall come before Him.

original: שִׁמְע֣וּ  שָׁ֭מוֹעַ  מִלָּתִ֑י  וְ֝אַֽחֲוָתִ֗י  בְּאָזְנֵיכֶֽם׃
translation: Hear, give ear to my word, and let my declaration be in your ears.

original: הִנֵּה־ נָ֭א  יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי  כִּֽי־ אֲנִ֥י  אֶצְדָּֽק׃
translation: Behold now, I know that I shall be vindicated.

original: מִי־ ה֭וּא  יָרִ֣יב  עִמָּדִ֑י  כִּֽי־ עַתָּ֖ה  אַחֲרִ֣ישׁ  וְאֶגְוָֽע׃
translation: Who is he who will contend with me? For now, I would hold my peace and expire.

original: אַךְ־ שְׁ֭תַּיִם  אַל־ תַּ֣עַשׂ  עִמָּדִ֑י  אָ֥ז  מִ֝פָּנֶ֗יךָ  לֹ֣א  אֶסָּתֵֽר׃
translation: Only two things do not do to me; then I will not hide myself from Your presence, O LORD.

original: כַּ֭פְּךָ  מֵעָלַ֣י  הַרְחַ֑ק  וְ֝אֵ֥מָתְךָ֗  אַֽל־ תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃
translation:
Remove Your hand from me,  
and let not the dread of You terrify me.

original: וּ֭קְרָא  וְאָנֹכִ֣י  אֶֽעֱנֶ֑ה  אֽוֹ־ אֲ֝דַבֵּ֗ר  וַהֲשִׁיבֵֽנִי׃
translation: Then call, and I will answer; or let me speak, and You respond to me.

original: כַּמָּ֣ה  לִ֭י  עֲוֺנ֣וֹת  וְחַטָּא֑וֹת  פִּֽשְׁעִ֥י  וְ֝חַטָּאתִ֗י  הֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
translation:
How many are my iniquities and sins?  
Make known to me my transgressions and my sin.

original: לָֽמָּה־ פָנֶ֥יךָ  תַסְתִּ֑יר  וְתַחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי  לְאוֹיֵ֣ב  לָֽךְ׃
translation: Why do You hide Your face, and count me as Your enemy?

original: הֶעָלֶ֣ה  נִדָּ֣ף  תַּעֲר֑וֹץ  וְאֶת־ קַ֖שׁ  יָבֵ֣שׁ  תִּרְדֹּֽף׃
translation: You terrify a driven leaf, and You pursue dry stubble.

original: כִּֽי־ תִכְתֹּ֣ב  עָלַ֣י  מְרֹר֑וֹת  וְ֝תוֹרִישֵׁ֗נִי  עֲוֺנ֥וֹת  נְעוּרָֽי׃
translation:
For You record bitter charges against me,  
And You cause me to inherit the iniquities of my youth.

original: וְתָ֘שֵׂ֤ם  בַּסַּ֨ד׀ רַגְלַ֗י  וְתִשְׁמ֥וֹר  כָּל־ אָרְחוֹתָ֑י  עַל־ שָׁרְשֵׁ֥י  רַ֝גְלַ֗י  תִּתְחַקֶּֽה׃
translation:
And You will set my feet in a secure place,  
and You will guard all my paths.  
Upon the soles of my feet You will inscribe.

original: לָ֭מָּה  רָגְשׁ֣וּ  גוֹיִ֑ם  וּ֝לְאֻמִּ֗ים  יֶהְגּוּ־ רִֽיק׃
translation:
Why do the nations rage,  
and the peoples plot in vain?

original: יִ֥תְיַצְּב֨וּ׀ מַלְכֵי־ אֶ֗רֶץ  וְרוֹזְנִ֥ים  נֽוֹסְדוּ־ יָ֑חַד  עַל־ יְ֝הוָה  וְעַל־ מְשִׁיחֽוֹ׃
translation:
The kings of the earth take their stand,  
and the rulers conspire together  
against the LORD and against His Anointed.

original: נְֽ֭נַתְּקָה  אֶת־ מֽוֹסְרוֹתֵ֑ימוֹ  וְנַשְׁלִ֖יכָה  מִמֶּ֣נּוּ  עֲבֹתֵֽימוֹ׃
translation:
Let us tear apart their bonds,  
and cast away their cords from us.

original: יוֹשֵׁ֣ב  בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם  יִשְׂחָ֑ק  אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י  יִלְעַג־ לָֽמוֹ׃
translation: He who is enthroned in the heavens laughs; the LORD derides them.

original: אָ֤ז  יְדַבֵּ֣ר  אֵלֵ֣ימוֹ  בְאַפּ֑וֹ  וּֽבַחֲרוֹנ֥וֹ  יְבַהֲלֵֽמוֹ׃
translation:
Then He spoke to them in His anger,  
and in His burning wrath He terrified them.

original: וַ֭אֲנִי  נָסַ֣כְתִּי  מַלְכִּ֑י  עַל־ צִ֝יּ֗וֹן  הַר־ קָדְשִֽׁי׃
translation:
And I have installed My king  
upon Zion, My holy mountain.

original: אֲסַפְּרָ֗ה  אֶֽ֫ל  חֹ֥ק  יְֽהוָ֗ה  אָמַ֘ר  אֵלַ֥י  בְּנִ֥י  אַ֑תָּה  אֲ֝נִ֗י  הַיּ֥וֹם  יְלִדְתִּֽיךָ׃
שְׁאַ֤ל  מִמֶּ֗נִּי  וְאֶתְּנָ֣ה  ג֭וֹיִם  נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ  וַ֝אֲחֻזָּתְךָ֗  אַפְסֵי־ אָֽרֶץ׃
translation:
Ask of me, and I will give the nations as your inheritance,  
and the ends of the earth as your possession.

original: תְּ֭רֹעֵם  בְּשֵׁ֣בֶט  בַּרְזֶ֑ל  כִּכְלִ֖י  יוֹצֵ֣ר  תְּנַפְּצֵֽם׃
translation:
You shall break them with a rod of iron;  
you shall shatter them like a potter’s vessel.

original: וְ֭עַתָּה  מְלָכִ֣ים  שֹׁ֣פְטֵי  אָֽרֶץ׃
translation: And now, O kings, judges of the earth.

original: עִבְד֣וּ  אֶת־ יְהוָ֣ה  בְּיִרְאָ֑ה  וְ֝גִ֗ילוּ  בִּרְעָדָֽה׃
translation: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

original: נַשְּׁקוּ־ בַ֡ר  פֶּן־ יֶאֱנַ֤ף׀ וְתֹ֬אבְדוּ  דֶ֗רֶךְ  כִּֽי־ יִבְעַ֣ר  כִּמְעַ֣ט  אַפּ֑וֹ  אַ֝שְׁרֵ֗י  כָּל־ ח֥וֹסֵי  בֽוֹ׃
translation: Kiss the son, lest He become angry, and you perish in the way, for His wrath is quickly kindled. Blessed are all who take refuge in Him.

original: שִׁגָּי֗וֹן  לְדָ֫וִ֥ד  אֲשֶׁר־ שָׁ֥ר  לַיהוָ֑ה  עַל־ דִּבְרֵי־ כ֝֗וּשׁ  בֶּן־ יְמִינִֽי׃
translation: A Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the LORD concerning the words of Cush, a Benjamite.

original: יְהוָ֣ה  אֱ֭לֹהַי  בְּךָ֣  הוֹשִׁיעֵ֥נִי  מִכָּל־ רֹ֝דְפַ֗י  וְהַצִּילֵֽנִי׃
translation: LORD, my God, in You I seek deliverance; save me from all my pursuers and rescue me.

original: יִגְמָר־ נָ֬א  רַ֨ע׀ רְשָׁעִים֮  וּתְכוֹנֵ֪ן  צַ֫דִּ֥יק  וּבֹחֵ֣ן  לִ֭בּ֗וֹת  וּכְלָי֗וֹת  אֱלֹהִ֥ים  צַדִּֽיק׃
translation:
May the evil of the wicked come to an end,  
and establish the righteous,  
O God who examines hearts and minds,  
the righteous God.

original: מָֽגִנִּ֥י  עַל־ אֱלֹהִ֑ים  מ֝וֹשִׁ֗יעַ  יִשְׁרֵי־ לֵֽב׃
translation:
My shield is with God,  
the Savior of the upright in heart.

original: אֱ֭לֹהִים  שׁוֹפֵ֣ט  צַדִּ֑יק  וְ֝אֵ֗ל  זֹעֵ֥ם  בְּכָל־ יֽוֹם׃
translation:
God is a righteous judge,  
and a God who expresses indignation every day.

original: אִם־ לֹ֣א  יָ֭שׁוּב  חַרְבּ֣וֹ  קַשְׁתּ֥וֹ  דָ֝רַ֗ךְ  וַֽיְכוֹנְנֶֽהָ׃
translation: If he does not turn back, his sword he wields, his bow he bends, and he prepares it.

original: וְ֭לוֹ  הֵכִ֣ין  כְּלֵי־ מָ֑וֶת  חִ֝צָּ֗יו  לְֽדֹלְקִ֥ים  יִפְעָֽל׃
translation: For Himself, He has prepared instruments of death; His arrows He fashions for the burning ones.

original: הִנֵּ֥ה  יְחַבֶּל־ אָ֑וֶן  וְהָרָ֥ה  עָ֝מָ֗ל  וְיָ֣לַד  שָֽׁקֶר׃
translation:
Behold, he conceives iniquity,  
becomes pregnant with trouble,  
and gives birth to deceit.

original: בּ֣וֹר  כָּ֭רָֽה  וַֽיַּחְפְּרֵ֑הוּ  וַ֝יִּפֹּ֗ל  בְּשַׁ֣חַת  יִפְעָֽל׃
translation:
He dug a pit and hollowed it out,  
but he fell into the pit he had made.

original: יָשׁ֣וּב  עֲמָל֣וֹ  בְרֹאשׁ֑וֹ  וְעַ֥ל  קָ֝דְקֳד֗וֹ  חֲמָס֥וֹ  יֵרֵֽד׃
translation:
His labor will return upon his head,  
and upon his crown, his violence will descend.

original: אוֹדֶ֣ה  יְהוָ֣ה  כְּצִדְק֑וֹ  וַ֝אֲזַמְּרָ֗ה  שֵֽׁם־ יְהוָ֥ה  עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translation:
I will give thanks to the LORD according to His righteousness,  
and I will sing praises to the name of the LORD, the Most High.

original: אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י  יִשְׁעֵ֗נוּ  עַל־ דְּבַ֥ר  כְּבֽוֹד־ שְׁמֶ֑ךָ  וְהַצִּילֵ֥נוּ  וְכַפֵּ֥ר  עַל־ חַ֝טֹּאתֵ֗ינוּ  לְמַ֣עַן  שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translation: O God of our salvation, for the sake of the glory of Your name, deliver us and atone for our sins, for the sake of Your name.

original: וּֽמֵאֲרָצ֗וֹת  קִ֫בְּצָ֥ם  מִמִּזְרָ֥ח  וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב  מִצָּפ֥וֹן  וּמִיָּֽם׃
translation: And from the lands He gathered them, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the sea.

original: יָקֵ֣ם  סְ֭עָרָה  לִדְמָמָ֑ה  וַ֝יֶּחֱשׁ֗וּ  גַּלֵּיהֶֽם׃
translation: He stirs up a storm into a calm, and their waves are stilled.

original: וַיִּשְׂמְח֥וּ  כִֽי־ יִשְׁתֹּ֑קוּ  וַ֝יַּנְחֵ֗ם  אֶל־ מְח֥וֹז  חֶפְצָֽם׃
translation: And they rejoiced because they were quiet; and He guided them to the haven of their desire.

original: יוֹד֣וּ  לַיהוָ֣ה  חַסְדּ֑וֹ  וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו  לִבְנֵ֥י  אָדָֽם׃
translation: Give thanks to the LORD for His steadfast love, and for His wondrous works to the children of mankind.

original: וִֽ֭ירֹמְמוּהוּ  בִּקְהַל־ עָ֑ם  וּבְמוֹשַׁ֖ב  זְקֵנִ֣ים  יְהַלְלֽוּהוּ׃
translation: And let them exalt Him in the assembly of the people, and in the council of the elders let them praise Him.

original: יָשֵׂ֣ם  נְהָר֣וֹת  לְמִדְבָּ֑ר  וּמֹצָ֥אֵי  מַ֝֗יִם  לְצִמָּאֽוֹן׃
translation:
He turns rivers into a desert,  
and springs of water into a parched wasteland.

original: אֶ֣רֶץ  פְּ֭רִי  לִמְלֵחָ֑ה  מֵ֝רָעַ֗ת  יֹ֣שְׁבֵי  בָֽהּ׃
translation: A fruitful land turned into salt, because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it.

original: יָשֵׂ֣ם  מִ֭דְבָּר  לַֽאֲגַם־ מַ֑יִם  וְאֶ֥רֶץ  צִ֝יָּ֗ה  לְמֹצָ֥אֵי  מָֽיִם׃
translation:
He turns the wilderness into a pool of water,  
and the dry land into springs of water.

original: וַיּ֣וֹשֶׁב  שָׁ֣ם  רְעֵבִ֑ים  וַ֝יְכוֹנְנ֗וּ  עִ֣יר  מוֹשָֽׁב׃
translation: And He settled the hungry there, and they established a city of habitation.

original: וַיִּזְרְע֣וּ  שָׂ֭דוֹת  וַיִּטְּע֣וּ  כְרָמִ֑ים  וַ֝יַּעֲשׂ֗וּ  פְּרִ֣י  תְבֽוּאָה׃
translation: And they sowed fields, and they planted vineyards, and they produced the fruit of the harvest.

original: וַיְבָרֲכֵ֣ם  וַיִּרְבּ֣וּ  מְאֹ֑ד  וּ֝בְהֶמְתָּ֗ם  לֹ֣א  יַמְעִֽיט׃
translation: And He blessed them, and they multiplied greatly, and their livestock did not decrease.

original: וַיִּמְעֲט֥וּ  וַיָּשֹׁ֑חוּ  מֵעֹ֖צֶר  רָעָ֣ה  וְיָגֽוֹן׃
translation:
And they were diminished and brought low,  
by oppression, calamity, and sorrow.

original: לְשׁ֣וֹן  חֲ֭כָמִים  תֵּיטִ֣יב  דָּ֑עַת  וּפִ֥י  כְ֝סִילִ֗ים  יַבִּ֥יעַ  אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translation:
The tongue of the wise enhances knowledge,  
but the mouth of fools pours forth folly.

original: לֵ֣ב  שָׂ֭מֵחַ  יֵיטִ֣ב  פָּנִ֑ים  וּבְעַצְּבַת־ לֵ֝ב  ר֣וּחַ  נְכֵאָֽה׃
translation:
A joyful heart makes the face cheerful,  
but by sorrow of heart the spirit is crushed.

original: לֵ֣ב  נָ֭בוֹן  יְבַקֶּשׁ־ דָּ֑עַת  וּפִ֥י  כְ֝סִילִ֗ים  יִרְעֶ֥ה  אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
translation:
A discerning heart seeks knowledge,  
but the mouth of fools feeds on folly.

original: כָּל־ יְמֵ֣י  עָנִ֣י  רָעִ֑ים  וְטֽוֹב־ לֵ֝֗ב  מִשְׁתֶּ֥ה  תָמִֽיד׃
translation:
All the days of the afflicted are filled with trouble,  
but a heart of gladness is a perpetual feast.

original: טוֹב־ מְ֭עַט  בְּיִרְאַ֣ת  יְהוָ֑ה  מֵאוֹצָ֥ר  רָ֝֗ב  וּמְה֥וּמָה  בֽוֹ׃
translation: Better is a little with the fear of the LORD, than abundant treasure with turmoil in it.

original: ט֤וֹב  אֲרֻחַ֣ת  יָ֭רָק  וְאַהֲבָה־ שָׁ֑ם  מִשּׁ֥וֹר  אָ֝ב֗וּס  וְשִׂנְאָה־ בֽוֹ׃
translation:
Better is a portion of vegetables where love abides,  
than a fattened ox accompanied by hatred.

original: אִ֣ישׁ  חֵ֭מָה  יְגָרֶ֣ה  מָד֑וֹן  וְאֶ֥רֶךאַ֝פַּ֗יִם  יַשְׁקִ֥יט  רִֽיב׃
translation:
A man of wrath stirs up strife,  
but one who is slow to anger quiets contention.

original: דֶּ֣רֶךְ  עָ֭צֵל  כִּמְשֻׂ֣כַת  חָ֑דֶק  וְאֹ֖רַח  יְשָׁרִ֣ים  סְלֻלָֽה׃
translation:
The way of the sluggard is like a hedge of thorns,  
but the path of the upright is a level highway.

original: בֵּ֣ן  חָ֭כָם  יְשַׂמַּח־ אָ֑ב  וּכְסִ֥יל  אָ֝דָ֗ם  בּוֹזֶ֥ה  אִמּֽוֹ׃
translation:
A wise son brings joy to his father,  
but a foolish man despises his mother.

original: אִ֭וֶּלֶת  שִׂמְחָ֣ה  לַחֲסַר־ לֵ֑ב  וְאִ֥ישׁ  תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה  יְיַשֶׁר־ לָֽכֶת׃
translation:
Folly is joy to one who lacks heart,  
but a man of understanding walks uprightly.

original: הָפֵ֣ר  מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת  בְּאֵ֣ין  ס֑וֹד  וּבְרֹ֖ב  יוֹעֲצִ֣ים  תָּקֽוּם׃
translation:
Plans are frustrated where there is no counsel,  
but with an abundance of advisors, they are established.

original: שִׂמְחָ֣ה  לָ֭אִישׁ  בְּמַעֲנֵה־ פִ֑יו  וְדָבָ֖ר  בְּעִתּ֣וֹ  מַה־ טּֽוֹב׃
translation:
Joy comes to a man through the answer of his mouth,  
and a word spoken in its proper time—how good it is!

original: הַהֹלְכִים֙  לָרֶ֣דֶת  מִצְרַ֔יִם  וּפִ֖י  לֹ֣א  שָׁאָ֑לוּ  לָעוֹז֙  בְּמָע֣וֹז  פַּרְעֹ֔ה  וְלַחְס֖וֹת  בְּצֵ֥ל  מִצְרָֽיִם׃
translation: Those who go down to Egypt and do not seek the counsel of my mouth, to take refuge in the protection of Pharaoh and to seek shelter in the shadow of Egypt.

original: אֶ֣לֶף  אֶחָ֗ד  מִפְּנֵי֙  גַּעֲרַ֣ת  אֶחָ֔ד  מִפְּנֵ֛י  גַּעֲרַ֥ת  חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה  עַ֣ד  אִם־ נוֹתַרְתֶּ֗ם  כַּתֹּ֨רֶן֙  עַל־ רֹ֣אשׁ  הָהָ֔ר  וְכַנֵּ֖ס  עַל־ הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
translation: One thousand will flee because of the rebuke of one; because of the rebuke of five, you will flee, until you are left like a mast on the top of a mountain, and like a banner on a hill.

original: וְלָכֵ֞ן  יְחַכֶּ֤ה  יְהוָה֙  לַֽחֲנַנְכֶ֔ם  וְלָכֵ֥ן  יָר֖וּם  לְרַֽחֶמְכֶ֑ם  כִּֽי־ אֱלֹהֵ֤י  מִשְׁפָּט֙  יְהוָ֔ה  אַשְׁרֵ֖י  כָּל־ ח֥וֹכֵי  לֽוֹ׃ס
translation: Therefore, the LORD will wait to show you favor, and therefore He will be exalted in showing you mercy. For the LORD is a God of justice; blessed are all who wait for Him.

original: כִּי־ עַ֛ם  בְּצִיּ֥וֹן  יֵשֵׁ֖ב  בִּירֽוּשָׁלִָ֑ם  בָּכ֣וֹ  לֹֽא־ תִבְכֶּ֗ה  חָנ֤וֹן  יָחְנְךָ֙  לְק֣וֹל  זַעֲקֶ֔ךָ  כְּשָׁמְעָת֖וֹ  עָנָֽךְ׃
translation: For the people in Zion shall dwell in Jerusalem. Weeping, you shall not weep; gracious, He will show you grace at the sound of your cry. As soon as He hears, He will answer you.

original: וְנָתַ֨ן  לָכֶ֧ם  אֲדֹנָ֛י  לֶ֥חֶם  צָ֖ר  וּמַ֣יִם  לָ֑חַץ  וְלֹֽא־ יִכָּנֵ֥ף  עוֹד֙  מוֹרֶ֔יךָ  וְהָי֥וּ  עֵינֶ֖יךָ  רֹא֥וֹת  אֶת־ מוֹרֶֽיךָ׃
translation: And the LORD will give you the bread of distress and the water of affliction, yet your teachers will no longer be hidden; your eyes will see your teachers.

original: וְאָזְנֶ֨יךָ֙  תִּשְׁמַ֣עְנָה  דָבָ֔ר  מֵֽאַחֲרֶ֖יךָ  לֵאמֹ֑ר  זֶ֤ה  הַדֶּ֨רֶךְ֙  לְכ֣וּ  ב֔וֹ  כִּ֥י  תַאֲמִ֖ינוּ  וְכִ֥י  תַשְׂמְאִֽילוּ׃
translation: And your ears shall hear a word behind you, saying, "This is the way; walk in it, whether you turn to the right or to the left."

original: וְטִמֵּאתֶ֗ם  אֶת־ צִפּוּי֙  פְּסִילֵ֣י  כַסְפֶּ֔ךָ  וְאֶת־ אֲפֻדַּ֖ת  מַסֵּכַ֣ת  זְהָבֶ֑ךָ  תִּזְרֵם֙  כְּמ֣וֹ  דָוָ֔ה  צֵ֖א  תֹּ֥אמַר  לֽוֹ׃
translation: And you will defile the overlay of your silver idols and the covering of your molten gold image. You will scatter them like menstrual impurity. "Go out," you will say to it.

original: וְנָתַן֩  מְטַ֨ר  זַרְעֲךָ֜  אֲשֶׁר־ תִּזְרַ֣ע  אֶת־ הָאֲדָמָ֗ה  וְלֶ֨חֶם֙  תְּבוּאַ֣ת  הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה  וְהָיָ֥ה  דָשֵׁ֖ן  וְשָׁמֵ֑ן  יִרְעֶ֥ה  מִקְנֶ֛יךָ  בַּיּ֥וֹם  הַה֖וּא  כַּ֥ר  נִרְחָֽב׃
translation: And He will give rain for your seed, which you will sow in the ground, and bread from the produce of the ground; and it will be rich and fertile. Your livestock will graze on that day in a broad pasture.

original: וְהָאֲלָפִ֣ים  וְהָעֲיָרִ֗ים  עֹֽבְדֵי֙  הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה  בְּלִ֥יל  חָמִ֖יץ  יֹאכֵ֑לוּ  אֲשֶׁר־ זֹרֶ֥ה  בָרַ֖חַת  וּבַמִּזְרֶֽה׃
translation: And the oxen and the donkeys, workers of the ground, will eat a sour mixture, winnowed with a shovel and with a fan.

original: וְדְבַר־ יְהוָ֑ה  כָּל־ הַ֨גּוֹלָ֔ה  אֲשֶׁר־ שִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי  מִירוּשָׁלִַ֖ם  בָּבֶֽלָה׃ס
translation: And the word of the LORD: all the exiles whom I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon.

original: כֹּֽה־ אָמַר֩  יְהוָ֨ה  צְבָא֜וֹת  אֱלֹהֵ֣י  יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל  אֶל־ אַחְאָ֤ב  בֶּן־ קֽוֹלָיָה֙  וְאֶל־ צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ  בֶן־ מַֽעֲשֵׂיָ֔ה  הַֽנִּבְּאִ֥ים  לָכֶ֛ם  בִּשְׁמִ֖י  שָׁ֑קֶר  הִנְנִ֣י׀ נֹתֵ֣ן  אֹתָ֗ם  בְּיַד֙  נְבֽוּכַדְרֶאצַּ֣ר  מֶֽלֶךְ־ בָּבֶ֔ל  וְהִכָּ֖ם  לְעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
translation: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Concerning Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who prophesy falsely to you in My name—behold, I am about to deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall strike them down before your eyes.

original: וְלֻקַּ֤ח  מֵהֶם֙  קְלָלָ֔ה  לְכֹל֙  גָּל֣וּת  יְהוּדָ֔ה  אֲשֶׁ֥ר  בְּבָבֶ֖ל  לֵאמֹ֑ר  יְשִֽׂמְךָ֤  יְהוָה֙  כְּצִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ  וּכְאֶחָ֔ב  אֲשֶׁר־ קָלָ֥ם  מֶֽלֶךְ־ בָּבֶ֖ל  בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
translation: And a curse shall be taken from them, for all the exiles of Judah who are in Babylon, saying, "May the LORD make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire."

original: יַ֡עַן  אֲשֶׁר֩  עָשׂ֨וּ  נְבָלָ֜ה  בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל  וַיְנַֽאֲפוּ֙  אֶת־ נְשֵׁ֣י  רֵֽעֵיהֶ֔ם  וַיְדַבְּר֨וּ  דָבָ֤ר  בִּשְׁמִי֙  שֶׁ֔קֶר  אֲשֶׁ֖ר  ל֣וֹא  צִוִּיתִ֑ם  וְאָנֹכִ֛י  הַיּוֹדֵ֥עַוָעֵ֖ד  נְאֻם־ יְהוָֽה׃ס
translation: Because they have committed an outrage in Israel, committing adultery with their neighbors’ wives and speaking in My name a false word that I did not command them—and I am the one who knows and bears witness, declares the LORD.

original: וְאֶל־ שְׁמַעְיָ֥הוּ  הַנֶּחֱלָמִ֖י  תֹּאמַ֥ר  לֵאמֹֽר׃
translation: And to Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall say, saying:

original: כֹּֽה־ אָמַ֞ר  יְהוָ֧ה  צְבָא֛וֹת  אֱלֹהֵ֥י  יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל  לֵאמֹ֑ר  יַ֡עַן  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  אַתָּה֩  שָׁלַ֨חְתָּ  בְשִׁמְכָ֜ה  סְפָרִ֗ים  אֶל־ כָּל־ הָעָם֙  אֲשֶׁ֣ר  בִּירוּשָׁלִַ֔ם  וְאֶל־ צְפַנְיָ֤ה  בֶן־ מַֽעֲשֵׂיָה֙  הַכֹּהֵ֔ן  וְאֶ֥ל  כָּל־ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים  לֵאמֹֽר׃
translation: Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: Because you have sent letters in your name to all the people who are in Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the priests, saying:

original: יְהוָ֞ה  נְתָנְךָ֣  כֹהֵ֗ן  תַּ֚חַת  יְהוֹיָדָ֣ע  הַכֹּהֵ֔ן  לִֽהְי֤וֹת  פְּקִדִים֙  בֵּ֣ית  יְהוָ֔ה  לְכָל־ אִ֥ישׁ  מְשֻׁגָּ֖ע  וּמִתְנַבֵּ֑א  וְנָתַתָּ֥ה  אֹת֛וֹ  אֶל־ הַמַּהְפֶּ֖כֶת  וְאֶל־ הַצִּינֹֽק׃
translation: The LORD has appointed you as priest in place of Jehoiada the priest, to be overseers in the house of the LORD for every man who is mad and prophesies; and you shall put him in the stocks and in the fetters.

original: וְעַתָּ֗ה  לָ֚מָּה  לֹ֣א  גָעַ֔רְתָּ  בְּיִרְמְיָ֖הוּ  הָֽעֲנְּתֹתִ֑י  הַמִּתְנַבֵּ֖א  לָכֶֽם׃
translation: And now, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah the Anathothite, who prophesies to you?

original: כִּ֣י  עַל־ כֵּ֞ן  שָׁלַ֥ח  אֵלֵ֛ינוּ  בָּבֶ֥ל  לֵאמֹ֖ר  אֲרֻכָּ֣ה  הִ֑יא  בְּנ֤וּ  בָתִּים֙  וְשֵׁ֔בוּ  וְנִטְע֣וּ  גַנּ֔וֹת  וְאִכְל֖וּ  אֶת־ פְּרִיהֶֽן׃
translation: For this reason, Babylon has sent to us, saying, “It is long. Build houses and dwell in them; plant gardens and eat their fruit.”

original: וָאֶפְתַּ֖ח  אֶת־ פִּ֑י  וַיַּ֣אֲכִלֵ֔נִי  אֵ֖ת  הַמְּגִלָּ֥ה  הַזֹּֽאת׃
translation: And I opened my mouth, and He caused me to consume this scroll.

original: וְק֣וֹל׀ כַּנְפֵ֣י  הַחַיּ֗וֹת  מַשִּׁיקוֹת֙  אִשָּׁ֣ה  אֶל־ אֲחוֹתָ֔הּ  וְק֥וֹל  הָאוֹפַנִּ֖ים  לְעֻמָּתָ֑ם  וְק֖וֹל  רַ֥עַשׁ  גָּדֽוֹל׃
translation: And the sound of the wings of the living creatures touching one to another, and the sound of the wheels beside them, and the sound of a great tumult.

original: וְר֥וּחַ  נְשָׂאַ֖תְנִי  וַתִּקָּחֵ֑נִי  וָאֵלֵ֥ךְ  מַר֙  בַּחֲמַ֣ת  רוּחִ֔י  וְיַד־ יְהוָ֥ה  עָלַ֖י  חָזָֽקָה׃
translation: And the Spirit lifted me up and took me, and I went in bitterness in the heat of my spirit, and the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.

original: וָאָב֨וֹא  אֶל־ הַגּוֹלָ֜ה  תֵּ֣ל  אָ֠בִיב  הַיֹּשְׁבִ֤ים  אֶֽל־ נְהַר־ כְּבָר֙  וָֽאֵשֵׁ֔ב  הֵ֖מָּה  יוֹשְׁבִ֣ים  שָׁ֑ם  וָשִׁבְעַ֥ת  יָמִ֖ים  מַשְׁמִ֥ים  בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
translation: And I came to the exiles at Tel Abib, who were dwelling by the river Chebar, and I sat where they were sitting. And for seven days I remained there, sitting among them in stunned silence.

original: וַיְהִ֕י  מִקְצֵ֖ה  שִׁבְעַ֣ת  יָמִ֑יםפ וַיְהִ֥י  דְבַר־ יְהוָ֖ה  אֵלַ֥י  לֵאמֹֽר׃
translation: And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying:

original: בֶּן־ אָדָ֕ם  לְבֵ֣ית  יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל  וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֤  מִפִּי֙  דָּבָ֔ר  וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֥  אוֹתָ֖ם  מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translation: Son of man, to the house of Israel, and hear from my mouth a word, and warn them from me.

original: בְּאָמְרִ֤י  לָֽרָשָׁע֙  מ֣וֹת  תָּמ֔וּת  וְלֹ֣א  הִזְהַרְתּ֗וֹ  וְלֹ֥א  דִבַּ֛רְתָּ  לְהַזְהִ֥יר  רָשָׁ֛ע  מִדַּרְכּ֥וֹ  הָרְשָׁעָ֖ה  לְחַיֹּת֑וֹ  ה֤וּא  רָשָׁע֙  בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ  יָמ֔וּת  וְדָמ֖וֹ  מִיָּדְךָ֥  אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
translation: When I say to the wicked, “You shall surely die,” and you do not warn him, nor speak to warn the wicked to turn from his wicked way, to save his life, that wicked person shall die in his iniquity, but his blood I will require at your hand.

original: וְאַתָּה֙  כִּֽי־ הִזְהַ֣רְתָּ  רָשָׁ֔ע  וְלֹא־ שָׁב֙  מֵֽרִשְׁע֔וֹ  וּמִדַּרְכּ֖וֹ  הָרְשָׁעָ֑ה  בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ  אַתָּ֖ה  אֶֽת־ נַפְשְׁךָ֥  הִצַּֽלְתָּ׃ס
translation: And you, when you have warned the wicked, and he does not turn from his wickedness or from his wicked way, you have delivered your soul by his iniquity.

original: וּבְשׁ֨וּב  צַדִּ֤יק  מִצִּדְקוֹ֙  וְעָ֣שָׂה  עָ֔וֶל  וְנָתַתִּ֥י  מִכְשׁ֛וֹל  לְפָנָ֖יו  לֹ֤א  הִזְהַרְתּוֹ֙  בְּחַטָּאת֣וֹ  יָמ֔וּת  וְלֹ֣א  תִזָּכַ֗רְןָ  צִדְקֹתָו֙אֲשֶׁ֣ר  עָשָׂ֔ה  וְדָמ֖וֹ  מִיָּדְךָ֥  אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
translation: And when a righteous man turns away from his righteousness and commits iniquity, I will place a stumbling block before him. If you did not warn him, he shall die in his sin, and his righteous deeds which he has done shall not be remembered. His blood I will require from your hand.

original: הִכֵּ֣יתִי  אֶתְכֶם֮  בַּשִּׁדָּפ֣וֹן  וּבַיֵּרָקוֹן֒  הַרְבּ֨וֹת  גַּנּוֹתֵיכֶ֧ם  וְכַרְמֵיכֶ֛ם  וּתְאֵנֵיכֶ֥ם  וְזֵיתֵיכֶ֖ם  יֹאכַ֣ל  הַגָּזָ֑ם  וְלֹֽא־ שַׁבְתֶּ֥ם  עָדַ֖י  נְאֻם־ יְהוָֽה׃ס
translation: "I struck you with blight and mildew; the locust devoured your many gardens, your vineyards, your fig trees, and your olive trees. Yet you did not return to me, declares the LORD."

original: אֶת־ הַדָּבָ֣ר  הַזֶּ֗ה  אֲשֶׁ֨ר  אָנֹכִ֜י  נֹשֵׂ֧א  עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם  קִינָ֖ה  בֵּ֥ית  יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translation: This matter, which I am laying upon you, a lamentation, O house of Israel.

original: שָׂנְא֥וּ  בַשַּׁ֖עַר  מוֹכִ֑יחַ  וְדֹבֵ֥ר  תָּמִ֖ים  יְתָעֵֽבוּ׃
translation: They hate the one who reproves at the gate, and they detest the one who speaks with integrity.

original: לָ֠כֵן  יַ֣עַן  בּוֹשַׁסְכֶ֞ם  עַל־ דָּ֗ל  וּמַשְׂאַת־ בַּר֙  תִּקְח֣וּ  מִמֶּ֔נּוּ  בָּתֵּ֥י  גָזִ֛ית  לֹא־ תֵ֣שְׁבוּ  בָ֑ם  כַּרְמֵי־ חֶ֣מֶד  נְטַעְתֶּ֔ם  וְלֹ֥א  תִשְׁתּ֖וּ  אֶת־ יֵינָֽם׃
translation: Therefore, because you trample on the poor and exact from him a tribute of grain, you shall not dwell in houses of hewn stone; though you have planted pleasant vineyards, you shall not drink their wine.

original: כִּ֤י  יָדַ֨עְתִּי֙  רַבִּ֣ים  פִּשְׁעֵיכֶ֔ם  וַעֲצֻמִ֖ים  חַטֹּֽאתֵיכֶ֑ם  צֹרְרֵ֤י  צַדִּיק֙  לֹ֣קְחֵי  כֹ֔פֶר  וְאֶבְיוֹנִ֖ים  בַּשַּׁ֥עַר  הִטּֽוּ׃
translation: For I know your many transgressions and your grievous sins—those who afflict the righteous, who take bribes, and turn aside the needy at the gate.

original: לָכֵ֗ן  הַמַּשְׂכִּ֛יל  בָּעֵ֥ת  הַהִ֖יא  יִדֹּ֑ם  כִּ֛י  עֵ֥ת  רָעָ֖ה  הִֽיא׃
translation: Therefore, the prudent one at that time will keep silent, for it is an evil time.

original: דִּרְשׁוּ־ ט֥וֹב  וְאַל־ רָ֖ע  לְמַ֣עַן  תִּֽחְי֑וּ  וִיהִי־ כֵ֞ן  יְהוָ֧ה  אֱלֹהֵֽי־ צְבָא֛וֹת  אִתְּכֶ֖ם  כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר  אֲמַרְתֶּֽם׃
translation: Seek good and not evil, so that you may live; and thus may the LORD, the God of hosts, be with you, as you have said.

original: שִׂנְאוּ־ רָע֙  וְאֶ֣הֱבוּ  ט֔וֹב  וְהַצִּ֥יגוּ  בַשַּׁ֖עַר  מִשְׁפָּ֑ט  אוּלַ֗י  יֶֽחֱנַ֛ן  יְהוָ֥ה  אֱלֹהֵֽי־ צְבָא֖וֹת  שְׁאֵרִ֥ית  יוֹסֵֽף׃ס
translation: Hate evil and love good, and establish justice in the gate; perhaps the LORD, the God of hosts, will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.

original: לָ֠כֵן  כֹּֽה־ אָמַ֨ר  יְהוָ֜ה  אֱלֹהֵ֤י  צְבָאוֹת֙  אֲדֹנָ֔י  בְּכָל־ רְחֹב֣וֹת  מִסְפֵּ֔ד  וּבְכָל־ חוּצ֖וֹת  יֹאמְר֣וּ  הוֹ־ ה֑וֹ  וְקָרְא֤וּ  אִכָּר֙  אֶל־ אֵ֔בֶל  וּמִסְפֵּ֖ד  אֶל־ י֥וֹדְעֵי  נֶֽהִי׃
translation:
Therefore, thus says the LORD, the God of Hosts, the Lord:  
"In all the squares there shall be mourning,  
and in all the streets they shall cry, 'Woe! Woe!'  
They shall summon the farmer to lamentation,  
and those skilled in wailing to mourning."

original: הָרִים֙  אֶת־ רִ֣יב  יְהוָ֔ה  וְהָאֵתָנִ֖ים  מֹ֣סְדֵי  אָ֑רֶץ  כִּ֣י  רִ֤יב  לַֽיהוָה֙  עִם־ עַמּ֔וֹ  וְעִם־ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל  יִתְוַכָּֽח׃
translation: Lift up the case of the LORD, and the foundations of the earth, for the LORD has a case against His people, and with Israel He will contend.

original: עַמִּ֛י  מֶה־ עָשִׂ֥יתִי  לְךָ֖  וּמָ֣ה  הֶלְאֵתִ֑יךָ  עֲנֵ֥ה  בִּֽי׃
translation: My people, what have I done to you? And how have I wearied you? Respond to me.

original: כִּ֤י  הֶעֱלִתִ֨יךָ֙  מֵאֶ֣רֶץ  מִצְרַ֔יִם  וּמִבֵּ֥ית  עֲבָדִ֖ים  פְּדִיתִ֑יךָ  וָאֶשְׁלַ֣ח  לְפָנֶ֔יךָ  אֶת־ מֹשֶׁ֖ה  אַהֲרֹ֥ן  וּמִרְיָֽם׃
translation: For I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and from the house of slavery I redeemed you; and I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

original: עַמִּ֗י  מַה־ יָּעַ֗ץ  בָּלָק֙  מֶ֣לֶךְ  מוֹאָ֔ב  וּמֶה־ עָנָ֥ה  אֹת֖וֹ  בִּלְעָ֣ם  בֶּן־ בְּע֑וֹר  מִן־ הַשִּׁטִּים֙  עַד־ הַגִּלְגָּ֔ל  לְמַ֕עַן  דַּ֖עַת  צִדְק֥וֹת  יְהוָֽה׃
translation: My people, what counsel did Balak, king of Moab, give? And what did Balaam son of Beor answer him? From Shittim to Gilgal, so that you may know the righteous acts of the LORD.

original: בַּמָּה֙  אֲקַדֵּ֣ם  יְהוָ֔ה  אִכַּ֖ף  לֵאלֹהֵ֣י  מָר֑וֹם  הַאֲקַדְּמֶ֣נּוּ  בְעוֹל֔וֹת  בַּעֲגָלִ֖ים  בְּנֵ֥י  שָׁנָֽה׃
translation:
With what shall I come before the LORD?  
Shall I bow down to the God on high?  
Shall I come before Him with burnt offerings,  
With yearling calves?

original: הֲיִרְצֶ֤ה  יְהוָה֙  בְּאַלְפֵ֣י  אֵילִ֔ים  בְּרִֽבְב֖וֹת  נַֽחֲלֵי־ שָׁ֑מֶן  הַבְּכוֹרִי֙  פִּשְׁעִ֔י  פְּרִ֥י  בִטְנִ֖י  חַטַּ֥את  נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translation:
Will the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams,  
with ten thousand rivers of oil?  
Shall I give my firstborn for my transgression,  
the fruit of my womb for the sin of my soul?

original: לְךָ֛  אָדָ֖ם  מַה־ טּ֑וֹב  וּמִמְּךָ֗  כִּ֣י  אִם־ עֲשׂ֤וֹת  מִשְׁפָּט֙  וְאַ֣הֲבַת  חֶ֔סֶד  וְהַצְנֵ֥עַ  לֶ֖כֶת  עִם־ אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃פ
translation: He has declared to you, O man, what is good; and what does the LORD require of you but to do justice, to love kindness, and to walk humbly with your God?

original: ק֤וֹל  יְהוָה֙  לָעִ֣יר  יִקְרָ֔א  וְתוּשִׁיָּ֖ה  יִרְאֶ֣ה  שְׁמֶ֑ךָ  שִׁמְע֥וּ  מַטֶּ֖ה  וּמִ֥י  יְעָדָֽהּ׃
translation:
The voice of the LORD calls to the city,  
and sound wisdom will regard Your name.  
Listen, O tribe,  
and who has appointed it?

original: וְיִשְׁתַּמֵּ֞ר  חֻקּ֣וֹת  עָמְרִ֗י  וְכֹל֙  מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה  בֵית־ אַחְאָ֔ב  וַתֵּלְכ֖וּ  בְּמֹֽעֲצוֹתָ֑ם  לְמַעַן֩  תִּתִּ֨י  אֹתְךָ֜  לְשַׁמָּ֗ה  וְיֹשְׁבֶ֨יהָ֙  לִשְׁרֵקָ֔ה  וְחֶרְפַּ֥ת  עַמִּ֖י  תִּשָּֽׂאוּ׃פ
translation: And the statutes of Omri shall be kept, and all the deeds of the house of Ahab; and you have walked in their counsels, so that I may make you a desolation, and its inhabitants a hissing, and you shall bear the reproach of my people.

original: οἱ  δὲ  ἀρχιερεῖς  λαβόντες  τὰ  ἀργύρια  εἶπαν  Οὐκ  ἔξεστιν  βαλεῖν  αὐτὰ  εἰς  τὸν  κορβανᾶν, ἐπεὶ  τιμὴ  αἵματός  ἐστιν.
translation: But the chief priests, having taken the silver pieces, said, “It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood.”

original: συμβούλιον  δὲ  λαβόντες  ἠγόρασαν  ἐξ  αὐτῶν  τὸν  ἀγρὸν  τοῦ  κεραμέως  εἰς  ταφὴν  τοῖς  ξένοις.
translation: And having taken counsel, they purchased with it the field of the potter as a burial place for strangers.

original: διὸ  ἐκλήθη  ὁ  ἀγρὸς  ἐκεῖνος  Ἀγρὸς  αἵματος  ἕως  τῆς  σήμερον.
translation: Therefore, that field was called the Field of Blood, up to the present day.

original: καὶ  λαβὼν  τὸ  σῶμα  ὁ  Ἰωσὴφ  ἐνετύλιξεν  αὐτὸ  ἐν  σινδόνι  καθαρᾷ,
translation: And having taken the body, Joseph wrapped it in a clean linen cloth.

original: καὶ  ἔθηκεν  αὐτὸ  ἐν  τῷ  καινῷ  αὐτοῦ  μνημείῳ  ὃ  ἐλατόμησεν  ἐν  τῇ  πέτρᾳ, καὶ  προσκυλίσας  λίθον  μέγαν  τῇ  θύρᾳ  τοῦ  μνημείου  ἀπῆλθεν.
translation: And he placed it in his new tomb, which he had cut out in the rock, and having rolled a large stone to the entrance of the tomb, he departed.

original: Ἦν  δὲ  ἐκεῖ  Μαριὰμ  ἡ  Μαγδαληνὴ  καὶ  ἡ  ἄλλη  Μαρία, καθήμεναι  ἀπέναντι  τοῦ  τάφου.
translation: Now Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.

original: Τῇ  δὲ  ἐπαύριον, ἥτις  ἐστὶν  μετὰ  τὴν  Παρασκευήν, συνήχθησαν  οἱ  ἀρχιερεῖς  καὶ  οἱ  Φαρισαῖοι  πρὸς  Πειλᾶτον
translation: Now on the next day, which is after the Preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered together to Pilate.

original: λέγοντες  Κύριε, ἐμνήσθημεν  ὅτι  ἐκεῖνος  ὁ  πλάνος  εἶπεν  ἔτι  ζῶν  Μετὰ  τρεῖς  ἡμέρας  ἐγείρομαι.
translation: saying, "LORD, we have remembered that that deceiver said, while still living, 'After three days I will rise.'"

original: κέλευσον  οὖν  ἀσφαλισθῆναι  τὸν  τάφον  ἕως  τῆς  τρίτης  ἡμέρας, μή  ποτε  ἐλθόντες  οἱ  μαθηταὶ  κλέψωσιν  αὐτὸν  καὶ  εἴπωσιν  τῷ  λαῷ  Ἠγέρθη  ἀπὸ  τῶν  νεκρῶν, καὶ  ἔσται  ἡ  ἐσχάτη  πλάνη  χείρων  τῆς  πρώτης.
translation: Command, therefore, that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest the disciples come and steal him and say to the people, ‘He has been raised from the dead,’ and the final deception will be worse than the first.

original: ἔφη  αὐτοῖς  ὁ  Πειλᾶτος  Ἔχετε  κουστωδίαν· ὑπάγετε  ἀσφαλίσασθε  ὡς  οἴδατε.
translation: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard. Go, secure it as you know how.”

original: οἱ  δὲ  πορευθέντες  ἠσφαλίσαντο  τὸν  τάφον  σφραγίσαντες  τὸν  λίθον  μετὰ  τῆς  κουστωδίας.
translation: And having gone, they secured the tomb by sealing the stone, with the guard.

original: ὡς  εἰσῆλθεν  εἰς  τὸν  οἶκον  τοῦ  Θεοῦ  καὶ  τοὺς  ἄρτους  τῆς  προθέσεως  λαβὼν  ἔφαγεν  καὶ  ἔδωκεν  τοῖς  μετ’  αὐτοῦ, οὓς  οὐκ  ἔξεστιν  φαγεῖν  εἰ  μὴ  μόνους  τοὺς  ἱερεῖς;
translation: As he entered the house of God and took the showbread, he ate it and gave it to those with him, which it is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone.

original: Εἶπεν  δὲ  καὶ  παραβολὴν  αὐτοῖς  Μήτι  δύναται  τυφλὸς  τυφλὸν  ὁδηγεῖν; οὐχὶ  ἀμφότεροι  εἰς  βόθυνον  ἐμπεσοῦνται;
translation: And He also spoke a parable to them: “Can a blind person guide another blind person? Will not both fall into a pit?”

original: οὐκ  ἔστιν  μαθητὴς  ὑπὲρ  τὸν  διδάσκαλον· κατηρτισμένος  δὲ  πᾶς  ἔσται  ὡς  ὁ  διδάσκαλος  αὐτοῦ.
translation: A disciple is not above the teacher, but everyone, when fully trained, will be like their teacher.

original: Τί  δὲ  βλέπεις  τὸ  κάρφος  τὸ  ἐν  τῷ  ὀφθαλμῷ  τοῦ  ἀδελφοῦ  σου, τὴν  δὲ  δοκὸν  τὴν  ἐν  τῷ  ἰδίῳ  ὀφθαλμῷ  οὐ  κατανοεῖς;
translation: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye?

original: πῶς  δύνασαι  λέγειν  τῷ  ἀδελφῷ  σου  Ἀδελφέ, ἄφες  ἐκβάλω  τὸ  κάρφος  τὸ  ἐν  τῷ  ὀφθαλμῷ  σου, αὐτὸς  τὴν  ἐν  τῷ  ὀφθαλμῷ  σοῦ  δοκὸν  οὐ  βλέπων; ὑποκριτά, ἔκβαλε  πρῶτον  τὴν  δοκὸν  ἐκ  τοῦ  ὀφθαλμοῦ  σοῦ, καὶ  τότε  διαβλέψεις  τὸ  κάρφος  τὸ  ἐν  τῷ  ὀφθαλμῷ  τοῦ  ἀδελφοῦ  σου  ἐκβαλεῖν.
translation: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, permit me to remove the speck that is in your eye,’ while you yourself do not see the log that is in your own eye? Hypocrite, first remove the log from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother’s eye.

original: Οὐ  γάρ  ἐστιν  δένδρον  καλὸν  ποιοῦν  καρπὸν  σαπρόν, οὐδὲ  πάλιν  δένδρον  σαπρὸν  ποιοῦν  καρπὸν  καλόν.
translation: For there is no good tree that produces rotten fruit, nor again a rotten tree that produces good fruit.

original: ἕκαστον  γὰρ  δένδρον  ἐκ  τοῦ  ἰδίου  καρποῦ  γινώσκεται· οὐ  γὰρ  ἐξ  ἀκανθῶν  συλλέγουσιν  σῦκα, οὐδὲ  ἐκ  βάτου  σταφυλὴν  τρυγῶσιν.
translation: For each tree is recognized by its own fruit; for figs are not gathered from thorns, nor are grapes harvested from a bramble bush.

original: ὁ  ἀγαθὸς  ἄνθρωπος  ἐκ  τοῦ  ἀγαθοῦ  θησαυροῦ  τῆς  καρδίας  προφέρει  τὸ  ἀγαθόν, καὶ  ὁ  πονηρὸς  ἐκ  τοῦ  πονηροῦ  προφέρει  τὸ  πονηρόν· ἐκ  γὰρ  περισσεύματος  καρδίας  λαλεῖ  τὸ  στόμα  αὐτοῦ.
translation: The good person brings forth good from the good treasure of the heart, and the evil person brings forth evil from the evil treasure. For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.

original: Τί  δέ  με  καλεῖτε  Κύριε  κύριε, καὶ  οὐ  ποιεῖτε  ἃ  λέγω;
translation: Why do you call me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and yet do not do what I say?

original: Πᾶς  ὁ  ἐρχόμενος  πρός  με  καὶ  ἀκούων  μου  τῶν  λόγων  καὶ  ποιῶν  αὐτούς, ὑποδείξω  ὑμῖν  τίνι  ἐστὶν  ὅμοιος.
translation: Everyone who comes to me and hears my words and does them, I will show you whom he is like.

original: ὅμοιός  ἐστιν  ἀνθρώπῳ  οἰκοδομοῦντι  οἰκίαν, ὃς  ἔσκαψεν  καὶ  ἐβάθυνεν  καὶ  ἔθηκεν  θεμέλιον  ἐπὶ  τὴν  πέτραν· πλημμύρης  δὲ  γενομένης  προσέρηξεν  ὁ  ποταμὸς  τῇ  οἰκίᾳ  ἐκείνῃ, καὶ  οὐκ  ἴσχυσεν  σαλεῦσαι  αὐτὴν  διὰ  τὸ  καλῶς  οἰκοδομῆσθαι  αὐτήν.
translation: He is like a man building a house, who dug deep and laid a foundation upon the rock. And when a flood arose, the river burst against that house, yet it was unable to shake it, because it had been well built.

original: Μετὰ  δὲ  ταῦτα  ἀνέδειξεν  ὁ  Κύριος  ἑτέρους  ἑβδομήκοντα, καὶ  ἀπέστειλεν  αὐτοὺς  ἀνὰ  δύο  πρὸ  προσώπου  αὐτοῦ  εἰς  πᾶσαν  πόλιν  καὶ  τόπον  οὗ  ἤμελλεν  αὐτὸς  ἔρχεσθαι.
translation: After these things, the LORD appointed seventy others and sent them two by two before His face into every city and place where He Himself was about to go.

original: ὁ  δὲ  ἐπεῖχεν  αὐτοῖς  προσδοκῶν  τι  παρ’  αὐτῶν  λαβεῖν.
translation: But he was observing them, expecting to receive something from them.

original: εἶπεν  δὲ  Πέτρος  Ἀργύριον  καὶ  χρυσίον  οὐχ  ὑπάρχει  μοι· ὃ  δὲ  ἔχω, τοῦτό  σοι  δίδωμι· ἐν  τῷ  ὀνόματι  Ἰησοῦ  Χριστοῦ  τοῦ  Ναζωραίου  περιπάτει.
translation: And Peter said, “Silver and gold I do not possess, but what I have, this I give to you: in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.”

original: καὶ  πιάσας  αὐτὸν  τῆς  δεξιᾶς  χειρὸς  ἤγειρεν  αὐτόν· παραχρῆμα  δὲ  ἐστερεώθησαν  αἱ  βάσεις  αὐτοῦ  καὶ  τὰ  σφυδρά,
translation: And taking hold of him by the right hand, he raised him up; and immediately his feet and ankles were strengthened.

original: καὶ  ἐξαλλόμενος  ἔστη  καὶ  περιεπάτει, καὶ  εἰσῆλθεν  σὺν  αὐτοῖς  εἰς  τὸ  ἱερὸν  περιπατῶν  καὶ  ἁλλόμενος  καὶ  αἰνῶν  τὸν  Θεόν.
translation: And leaping up, he stood and began to walk, and he entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping and praising God.

original: καὶ  εἶδεν  πᾶς  ὁ  λαὸς  αὐτὸν  περιπατοῦντα  καὶ  αἰνοῦντα  τὸν  Θεόν·
translation: And all the people saw him walking and praising God.

original: Λαλούντων  δὲ  αὐτῶν  πρὸς  τὸν  λαὸν, ἐπέστησαν  αὐτοῖς  οἱ  ἱερεῖς  καὶ  ὁ  στρατηγὸς  τοῦ  ἱεροῦ  καὶ  οἱ  Σαδδουκαῖοι,
translation: And as they were speaking to the people, the priests came upon them, along with the captain of the temple and the Sadducees.

original: γνωστὸν  ἔστω  πᾶσιν  ὑμῖν  καὶ  παντὶ  τῷ  λαῷ  Ἰσραὴλ, ὅτι  ἐν  τῷ  ὀνόματι  Ἰησοῦ  Χριστοῦ  τοῦ  Ναζωραίου, ὃν  ὑμεῖς  ἐσταυρώσατε, ὃν  ὁ  Θεὸς  ἤγειρεν  ἐκ  νεκρῶν, ἐν  τούτῳ  οὗτος  παρέστηκεν  ἐνώπιον  ὑμῶν  ὑγιής.
